Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you’ll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry’s top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city’s best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We’d love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.
Show more
HTML:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include

  • Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
  • Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
  • Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
  • Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
  • Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
  • Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
  • Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
  • Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues

About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you’ll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You

  • High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
  • Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
  • Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
  • Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
  • Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
  • Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
  • Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
  • Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner

Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry’s top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:

  • A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
  • Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
  • Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
  • Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees

Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city’s best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We’d love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
With Confluent, organisations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day – we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure - data streaming. This technology will allow every organisation to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day.

One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform.

Data Connects Us.

About The Role

This role will be a key member of the Field Reporting & Analytics team to support the Sales and Customer Success Group (CSG) organizations. In this role, you will utilize our business systems data to analyze and provide insight into the organization's historical and forecasted performance. Additionally, this role will apply creativity and analytical thinking to design and implement operational dashboards and ad hoc reporting.

The role requires that you have a strong technical knowledge of database and business intelligence design, and how to transform data into insight so we can utilize world class functional dashboards, reporting, and analysis to ensure data-driven decisions are a daily part of how we work. To do this you will work with our Sales and CSG Strategy & Operations teams to provide business insight.

A background in Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau, SQL, experiences supporting sales, pre-sales and/or a post-sales customer business is preferred. This position reports to the Senior Manager, Business Analytics in Field Analytics & Reporting.

What You Will Do


Create and maintain Salesforce CRM Analytics/Tableau dashboards that allow us to measure and effectively execute strategies that guide the Customer Solutions Group & Sales Team to actions and investment
Own core activities for small analytic projects of moderate to high complexity
Gather requirements, design, and build dashboards & analytic reporting based on stakeholders & leadership needs to help monitor performance for all key indicators.
Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to define and maintain a set of data definitions and available measures across the Sales & CSG business
Work with the Senior Manager, Business Analytics to establish a roadmap and rationalization plan for all of our dashboards, reporting, analysis tools, and processes deployed across Sales & CSG


What You Will Bring


BS degree, preferably with a post graduate degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Computing, Business, Operations, or a related discipline.
Relevant industry experience or demonstrable applied knowledge of working with Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau or other data visualization software, Salesforce, SQL (large data sets/data warehousing).
The ability to communicate cross-functionally, derive requirements, set and meet deadlines, and deliver insightful analysis and/or models
Keen attention to detail while completing complex tasks
Open, growth mindset and high degrees of self motivation, fostered in a fast-paced, high growth, dynamic environment


Come As You Are

At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Click HERE to review our Candidate Privacy Notice which describes how and when Confluent, Inc., and its group companies, collects, uses, and shares certain personal information of California job applicants and prospective employees.

Title: Data Analyst, Crypto and Payments
Description:
About MoonPay 🌖💸




Hi, we’re MoonPay. We’re here to onboard the world to Web3.




Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.




What we do

We’re the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products — just take a look on Trustpilot.




We’re also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.




But that’s not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It’s taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.




So whatever your background, we’re sure there’s something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.




About the Opportunity ✍️

This is an opportunity for an ambitious Data Analyst to have a huge impact across the organization, while working in a complex and rapidly changing crypto environment. We are looking for someone with experience or an interest in end-to-end “full-stack” data work, including: data strategy, analytics engineering, (advanced) analytics and data science. The main focus of this position will be to play a crucial role in supporting our Accounting and FP&A functions.







What you will do

Build robust data models and infrastructure downstream of backend services and external data sources, which support reconciliation, internal reporting, and ad-hoc analysis
Develop “The Ledger”, which tracks all our crypto and fiat movements from external data sources
Design, build and scale a MoonPay-wide approach to reconciliation for cash and crypto using both internal and external data sources.
Conduct more strategic analysis on specific topics such as the Flow of Funds from both a cash and crypto perspective
Collaborate with the finance team and the crypto engineering team to conduct investigations into areas such as issues with crypto delivery
Working closely with accounting & finance to build custom tables & reporting to support their efforts.
Communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences (across different teams)
Collaborate cross-functionally with other teams on Product, Engineering, and Finance




About You

As a Data Analyst, you’ll be expected to work cross-functionally with different parts of the organization while maintaining a focus on Data and Finance. Being someone who can build robust data models to contribute to the current ecosystem of data products. We are seeking someone with experience or an interest in “full-stack” data work, from data engineering to data analytics.




What you will need

Advanced SQL, data modeling, and data visualization tools are second nature to you
You have experience of and/or interest in working with a finance team, or within a finance function
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including finance managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives










Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our “BLOCK Values” are at the heart of everything we do - and they are…




B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen




MoonPay Perks

Equity package 📈

Unlimited holidays 🏝

Paid parental leave 🍼

Annual training budget 💻

Home office setup allowance 🪑

Monthly budget to spend on our products 💰

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless 🚀

Freedom, autonomy and responsibility 💪




Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.




Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we’ll do our best to provide assistance.




Commitment To Diversity

At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. That’s why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.




Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Data Analytics Specialist




¿Estás listo para asumir nuevos desafíos y marcar la diferencia? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad de unirte a un equipo innovador y dinámico! 🌟




🧩 Tus desafíos serán:

Diseñar, mantener y mejorar modelos de datos en el data warehouse corporativo.
Colaborar estrechamente con nuestro equipo de datos: analistas, ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos.
Analizar y comprender requisitos del negocio para transformarlos en requisitos de datos e insights accionables.
Participar en la creación de reportes y dashboards junto al equipo de business intelligence.
Trabajar con product owners y otros equipos para definir, monitorear e identificar métricas, KPIs y nuevas oportunidades.




📚 Requisitos clave:

Experiencia: Más de 4 años en un rol similar.
Educación: Grado universitario en Ingeniería, Estadística, Matemáticas o campos relacionados.
Idiomas: Inglés nivel B2 (intermedio-alto).
Tecnologías: Dominio medio-alto de SQL y Python.
Habilidades: Excelentes habilidades de comunicación para adaptarse a diferentes stakeholders, resolución de problemas, iniciativa, atención al detalle, pensamiento analítico, curiosidad y creatividad.
Ubicación: Barcelona
Modalidad: 50 % remoto




🎁 Beneficios que te encantarán:

✅ Horarios de entrada flexibles y política de teletrabajo.

✅ Seguro médico privado.

✅ Beneficios para tu bienestar físico y mental.







¡Queremos conocerte! 💬

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Regional Operations (They/He/She)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.


We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.


💪Our career development philosophy.


We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.


🤝Our commitment to being a force for good.


Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.


We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for an Data Operations intern to work in our team in Barcelona. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market.

THE JOURNEY


Analyze data generated by our core operations in order to improve our stakeholder experience (Couriers, Users and Partners);
Come up with data insights to help improve most important KPIs for the whole Country (e.g., Delivery time, Cancellations, efficiency, Cross departmental projects... );
Proactively spot inefficiencies, understand root causes and propose data driven actions;
Process standardization: Improve processes on behalf of Glovers through projects (when necessary)
KPIs tracking: Manage scheduling, attendance and general administration of Info-Sessions while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and analysis of KPIs ∙ Communicate effectively with the local Operations Manager on customer support processes and operations
Work close with the other departments to monitor any structural process optimization;
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact thinking out of the box!


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Engineering, Maths or any technological domain
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
Excel proficiency
Experience in SQL is a must
Professional English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more
HTML:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

  • We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
  • We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
  • We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
  • We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.

💪Our career development philosophy.

  • We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
  • We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
  • We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.

🤝Our commitment to being a force for good.

  • Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
  • We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
  • We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for an Data Operations intern to work in our team in Barcelona. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market.

THE JOURNEY

  • Analyze data generated by our core operations in order to improve our stakeholder experience (Couriers, Users and Partners);
  • Come up with data insights to help improve most important KPIs for the whole Country (e.g., Delivery time, Cancellations, efficiency, Cross departmental projects... );
  • Proactively spot inefficiencies, understand root causes and propose data driven actions;
  • Process standardization: Improve processes on behalf of Glovers through projects (when necessary)
  • KPIs tracking: Manage scheduling, attendance and general administration of Info-Sessions while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and analysis of KPIs ∙ Communicate effectively with the local Operations Manager on customer support processes and operations
  • Work close with the other departments to monitor any structural process optimization;
  • Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact thinking out of the box!

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • Bachelor in Engineering, Maths or any technological domain
  • Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
  • Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
  • Excel proficiency
  • Experience in SQL is a must
  • Professional English
  • An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • 🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • 🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • 🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • 🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: DATA SCIENTIST & DATA ANALIST_COE ATM
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

Es necesaria la incorporación de un Product manager para el Centro de Excelencia de ATMs (CoE ATM) del área COSTUMER EXPERIENCE ubicado en Barcelona. El puesto de trabajo a cubrir se ubica en un equipo de trabajo que tiene como objetivo diseñar e implementar herramientas analíticas de seguimiento que permiten a COE ATM, entre otros stakeholders, hacer una monitorización efectiva de las funcionalidades, la calidad, evolución del parque y comportamiento de los cajeros.Así mismo este equipo tiene la función de asegurar la disponibilidad de los datos en el entorno corporativo necesarios para la gestión y toma de decisiones del COE ATM. 

 

Funciones y responsabilidades:

 

A nivel de Project Management / Product Management:

 

Gestión y priorización del backlog de cuadros de mando y/o herramientas analíticas, garantizando la alineación con los objetivos del equipo y retos de la entidad
Coordinación con los principales stakeholders: áreas de negocio/producto, UX, tecnología, BI y diseñadores (UI)
Obtención de insights y/o casos de uso en colaboración con el área de Usabilidad (UX)
Definición de los requerimientos técnicos y funcionales (historias de usuarios), participando también en la definición, revisión y ejecución de las pruebas
Seguimiento del nivel de uso de las herramientas implantadas y de la satisfacción de los usuarios, así como el plan de acción y estrategia de promoción de las nuevas herramientas a nivel de la red de comercial de la entidad y/o usuarios (gestores)
Coordinación con el equipo de analítica interna (Advanced Analytics) para industrializar nuevas lógicas de cálculo basadas en grandes volúmenes de datos y algoritmos complejos.

 

A nivel de disponibilidad y calidad de los datos:

 

Identificación y coordinación con Tech del origen de los datos necesarios y establecer las necesidades de carga/ingesta de dichos datos para modelado de tablas en datapool y disponibilidad del dato para consumo (ECIs)
Controles de calidad del dato: homogéneos entre herramientas de visualización y consistentes.
Establecer tablas maestras o auxiliares para la categorización de datos
Establecer criterios de cálculo
Definir nuevas métricas y kpi así como la automatización para el seguimiento  

 

Dependencia: Director de ATMs

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulados en Ingeniería, Business Intelligence, Matemáticas, o similar.
Experiencia como Product Management y/o Project Management en entornos analíticos valorándose experiencia en iniciativas de experiencia cliente en entornos digitales. 
Conocimiento en herramientas de programación (SQL, Python, R, SAS) y de herramientas BI (QlikSense, SAS). 
Nivel Avanzado en suite MS Office (Excel, PPT y Word).
Experiencia desarrollando Business Cases
Experiencia en ciencias de datos, modelización y clustering
Conocimientos necesarios para almacenar y explotar información para desarrollo de negocio
Valorable conocimiento Tealium (tag manager)
Valorable experiencia previa en modelo de seguimiento de experiencia y feedback de los clientes, siendo capaz de identificar mejoras en las operativas y en los servicios de la entidad gracias a escuchar la voz del cliente
Valorable experiencia previa en entornos financieros o banca, en consultoría en proyectos similares de transformación digital, demostrando conocimiento sobre el ecosistema digital y sobre las últimas tendencias
Buena capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas.
Nivel de inglés (mínimo B2)
Competencias clave

 

Actitud proactiva y capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de forma transversal. 
Alto nivel de creatividad, iniciativa y autonomía, siendo capaz de liderar y gestionar las iniciativas bajo su responsabilidad 
Orientación al detalle y con capacidad de priorización y coordinación de varios proyectos.
Resiliencia y capacidad de adaptación a entornos cambiantes y de alta criticidad.
Flexibilidad para trabajar con autonomía con calendarios ajustados.  
¿Qué ofrecemos?

 

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad
Show more

  • Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
  • Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Junior Data Engineer




Position Overview

Our Mission is “Health for all and Hunger for none” Every day, we are privileged to work on purposeful cutting-edge projects to bring our mission to life. Join us to have a career that you can put your passion into practice and make an impact using Science for a better life , join the global team of Crop BI as a Junior Data Engineer.




Key Tasks & Responsibilities

• Develops and implements accurate, consistent, and secure data sets supporting key Business Intelligence Team internal metrics

• Leverages baseline understanding of defined Business Intelligence Team’s internal metrics to develop and manage tracking mechanisms.

• Develops and maintains the necessary data and documentation to understand the data elements, respective sources, expected range of answers.

• Works with BI Team members to maintain a data repository, regular reporting, and ad-hoc reporting for Business Intelligence Team internal metrics

• Analyzes data for opportunities and coordinates data quality problem solving efforts

• Monitors existing, regular, data validity mechanisms to detect data quality gaps.

• Leverages and coordinates expertise of system and database subject matter experts to solve data quality deficiencies.

• Understands and leverages common definitions of cross functional and cross brand metrics and calculations.

• Collaboratively builds business and data knowledge and solutions

• Works with IT Data Stewards and Data Support Teams to understand business rules behind available data to enable proper interpretation for metrics and problem-solving facilitation.

• Uses business acumen and functional stakeholder input to understand data needed for process enablement, to locate the needed data, and to translate to the right measures at the right granularity to answer the question being asked with appropriate presentation.

• Works both independently and collaboratively with a team of peers to fully satisfy stakeholder and team data needs

• Creates and Delivers Change Management Plans

• Builds strong working relationships with Supply Chain Management and Commercial data consumers to understand

the link between data requests and business process decisions.

• Understands and leverages basic change management concepts and processes to develop change management plans designed to shorten acceptance and learning curves for new and changing business intelligence solutions.

• Uses interpersonal skills to deliver the planned communications and training to the target audiences for new and changed business intelligence solutions.




Qualifications & Competencies

• Minimum Bachelor’s Degree; Business Intelligence, Data Science, Computer Science, or Engineering degree preferred.

• 1+ years of experience working with data (e.g., Finance, Data Warehousing, Data Analytics, Reporting), or a Masters degree in related field (e.g., Business Intelligence, Data Science, Analytics); Ag Industry and/or supply chain knowledge strongly preferred;

• Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills in the data arena. Preferred: experience working with data in relational databases using SQL or equivalent

• Demonstrated technical competency of organizing and facilitating problem solving in a group environment & demonstrated project coordination experience.

• Business acumen in the area of relating data to business process drivers and performance management. Tailors communication appropriately to both business and IT audiences.

• Collaborative team-focused delivery experience

• Preferred: experience leveraging one or more tools in the Business Intelligence space (e.g., Tableau, SAP Business Objects Webi, Web FOCUS, QlikView, Microsoft BI, Microstrategy, Cognos, Alteryx, Paxata, Trifacta, Informatica, Talend, Ascential) or with data analysis/reporting using standard business tools (e.g., Advanced Excel, Advanced Microsoft Access)




Required System Skills

• Proven experience as a BI Developer (Reporting and Data)

• SQL experience (Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata)

• Strong background in Reporting Tools: SAP Business Objects/Webi, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikView or equivalent (e.g., Power BI, Cognos, MicroStrategy)

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Analyst BU SEMEA M/F
Description:
At the heart of a Group where every job has a meaning, we're looking for our future Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Analyst BU SEMEA M/F in Barcelona, Spain. 📍🌍




At Petit Forestier Group, every employee is a talent. Through your expertise and skills, you'll help us to improving quality of life by mastering the cold chain. 🚛❄




Why join us? 🚀

A dynamic and stimulating environment within the Group, with the ambition of becoming the world leader in sustainable refrigerated rental.
A dynamic team ready to take on new challenges every day.
Opportunities for development and continuous training, through an integrated E-Learning tool.




What will the role be about 💥

Develop visually appealing and effective PowerPoint presentations tailored to the needs of executive committees and other key audiences.
Analyze and synthesize large volumes of data, converting it into comprehensible visualizations using Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Qlik, or other data visualization tools.
Collaborate closely with the BU Director and cross-functional teams to understand presentation goals and expectations, ensuring alignment with specific audiences.
Create impactful charts, tables, and infographics to facilitate the understanding of complex data and enhance the visual narrative.
Ensure all presentations align with corporate identity and brand standards.
Stay updated on best practices in presentation design and data visualization trends.
Prepare and edit content in English and French, adapting language and style to the audience and context.
Prepare reports, briefings, and confidential documents.
Provide support to both external and internal clients of the company.
Collaborate on internal projects.




Who are we looking for (must have / nice to have) 💥

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in finance, data analysis, related fields, communications, or a similar role.
Previous experience in financial and business data analysis and creating presentations for executive committees or high-level audiences.
Advanced proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel; good knowledge of data visualization software (Power BI/Qlik).
Analytical skills: data analysis, interpretation, visualization, and dashboard/KPI management.
Proficiency in English and French, both written and spoken (Cambridge level C1 or C2).
Ability to analyze complex data and present it clearly and effectively.
Creative approach with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects efficiently.
Proactive and flexible attitude, with the ability to work under pressure.
Creativity and proactivity in contributing innovative ideas and practical solutions.
Graphic design experience is a plus.
High discretion and the ability to handle confidential information.




What are we offering (benefits) 💥

We offer you a varied and versatile full-time position in a friendly team with a competitive salary. You will join a fast-growing company with committed employees and a family atmosphere.

Are you enthusiastic, reliable, technically skilled and do you recognize yourself in this position? Then we look forward to receiving your application!

Competitive salary
Holiday pay
Home Office Policy
Free parking
Career opportunities
Training opportunities
Birthday off
Fresh Fruits at the Office




You'll be part of a team that embodies the Group's values: passion, service, commitment and agility.




All our positions are open to the recruitment of disabled workers. 👩‍💼👨‍💼




Petit Forestier Group, a profession that makes sense. 💼

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

The goal of Business Performance AX (BPAX) team is to provide analytical insights at global level to key internal stakeholders. Aligned with the Criteo culture of data-based decision making, the team has a unique capability to unveil business opportunities: insights on business performance drive sales and operational actions that maximize revenue and margin.

As an Analyst Intern in the Business Performance team you will implement a data-driven approach to understand and explain the business. This role involves working with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyse data and create a comprehensive story.

Your Mission:


Provide analytical insights on Criteo performance, changes of market environment and competition
Size business growth opportunities / threats. Translate findings into actionable insights for multiple levels of stakeholders
Based on external and internal data, understand client behaviours, qualify potential of clients and prospects on new and existing business



Who You Are:


Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Business School)
Strong intellectual curiosity and analytical skills. Ability to structure and solve difficult problems
Experience in Python and SQL. Knowledge of Tableau is a plus
A good grasp of statistical modelling
Very good communication skills and fluency in English
Proactivity and commitment



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

HTML:
What You'll Do:

The goal of Business Performance AX (BPAX) team is to provide analytical insights at global level to key internal stakeholders. Aligned with the Criteo culture of data-based decision making, the team has a unique capability to unveil business opportunities: insights on business performance drive sales and operational actions that maximize revenue and margin.

As an Analyst Intern in the Business Performance team you will implement a data-driven approach to understand and explain the business. This role involves working with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyse data and create a comprehensive story.

Your Mission:

  • Provide analytical insights on Criteo performance, changes of market environment and competition
  • Size business growth opportunities / threats. Translate findings into actionable insights for multiple levels of stakeholders
  • Based on external and internal data, understand client behaviours, qualify potential of clients and prospects on new and existing business


Who You Are:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Business School)
  • Strong intellectual curiosity and analytical skills. Ability to structure and solve difficult problems
  • Experience in Python and SQL. Knowledge of Tableau is a plus
  • A good grasp of statistical modelling
  • Very good communication skills and fluency in English
  • Proactivity and commitment


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Description:
The Sales Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to assess the potential success and productivity of client accounts. This role requires a highly data-driven approach with a focus on leveraging advanced Excel skills including algorithms and macros to provide actionable insights that drive sales strategies and decision-making.

This role has high earning potential due to the commission structure and industries supported.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis and Interpretation
Collect clean and analyze sales data to identify trends patterns and anomalies.
Evaluate the potential of new client accounts and the performance and productivity of existing client accounts using various data sources.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Advanced Excel Proficiency
Utilize advanced Excel functions including but not limited to VLOOKUP pivot tables and conditional formatting.
Create and maintain complex algorithms to automate data analysis processes.
Develop and implement macros to streamline repetitive tasks and improve efficiency.
Reporting and Visualization
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Use data visualization tools to present data in an easily understandable format.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Strategic Planning and Support
Collaborate with sales teams to develop strategies that enhance client account
performance.
Support strategic planning by providing data-driven insights and forecasts.
Identify opportunities for improvement and suggest initiatives to boost sales
productivity.
Data Management
Ensure the accuracy integrity and security of sales data.
Maintain and update databases and systems used for data analysis.
Implement best practices for data management and analysis.


Requirements

Skills Qualifications


Bachelor s degree in Business Statistics Data Science or a related field.
Proven experience as a data analyst preferably in a sales or marketing
environment.
Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft Excel including advanced functions
algorithms and macros.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present data findings clearly
and concisely.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications


Master s degree in a related field.
Familiarity with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce).


Personal Attributes


Strong appetite for sales and making comission
analytical and data oriented
social media savvy
interest in disrupting a new market


Benefits


Relocation Assistance Relocation to the Canary Islands
Competitive Salary Highly attractive compensation package commensurate with experience and skills.
Remote Work We offer flexible working hours and location options
Benefits Comprehensive health and wellenss benefits
Professional Growth Opportunities for career advancement and personal development in a fast-growing company.
Inclusive Culture Be part of a diverse and collaborative team committed to innovation and excellence.
Collaborative and Supportive Team Working with team members that understands the importance of the work you ll be doing


data, Excel

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can’t see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that’s still got a start-up heart.

About Our Marketing Analytics Team

Our Kiwi.com Marketing Analytics team supports various Marketing areas, helping to ensure they operate efficiently and meet their goals. This involves a strong focus on evaluating the impact on our global profitability and assessing the return on investment for current marketing activities and uncovering potential areas of opportunity. Our work is particularly interesting because it analyzes complex data to uncover insights that drive strategic decision-making. The insights and strategies developed by our Marketing Analytics team inform marketing decisions that enhance overall profitability and contribute to the sustainable growth of Kiwi.com.

What You Will Do


You will analyze and report on CRM performance, identifying key drivers and growth opportunities.
You will uncover insights and develop hypotheses for testing, iteration, and continuous improvement.
You will monitor and assess marketing campaign performance, providing actionable recommendations based on CRM data.
You will build and refine models to understand customer behavior, including Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) and Recency, Frequency and Monetary value RFM).
You will model business cases for new campaigns and promotions focused on customer acquisition and retention.
You will collaborate with stakeholders and the CRM team to create impactful, user-friendly self-service dashboards, align on data strategies, ensure data quality, and implement CRM-driven initiatives.


What You Will Need


Previous experience in CRM systems and/or e-commerce businesses, with a focus on analyzing customer data to derive actionable insights.
Your advanced SQL and Excel/Google Sheets skills, with proficiency in data extraction, manipulation, and reporting.
Experience working with Data Visualization Tools (we use Looker).
Experience in building data models that drive revenue growth and customer loyalty, including developing business cases for promotions to acquire or retain customers.
Your proven knowledge of CRM platforms such as Exponea (or equivalent) and experience leveraging this data for targeted marketing and customer engagement activities.
A strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and quality in data analysis and reporting
Your curiosity, openness to learning, and strong collaboration skills.
You are a great communicator with excellent spoken and written English, including your proven ability to communicate complex results to less data-savvy users.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Wellhub membership, the annual subscription for El Bicing.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it’s finished, we’re going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/.

Title: Data Analyst Marketing Intelligence (f/m/d)
Description:
To support our Marketing Intelligence team we are searching for a Data Analyst Marketing Intelligence (f/m/d) to be based in our Barcelona office.

What You Will Do


Analyze customer journey behavior and generate findings into online marketing campaigns
Design, build and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and insights
Development and implementation of marketing attribution / allocation models across all media channels such as SEA, SEO, Affiliate, Email, Performance Display
Partner with the data engineering team to improve data pipelines and ensure seamless integration of new data sources
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data
Continuous optimization, monitoring, and quality checkups of already existing processes & daily business


Who You Are


University degree in (business) informatics, mathematics, data science, economics/business administration, or another relevant field; understanding of (online) marketing is a bonus
At least 4 years work experience within an analytical role (such as BI, web analytics or CRM) ideally within an e-commerce environment
Strong analytical skills with experience in working with large datasets
Advanced knowledge of statistical methods and tools (e.g. SQL, Python, R, Excel, ETL)
Experience with Power BI is a plus
Understanding of business drivers with a strong analytical mindset and affinity to numbers
Initial experience with performance marketing channels, ad-tech and web-tracking
Result driven and high standards in quality and precision
You are a passionate, committed team player with a high degree of personal initiative
Fluent in Business English


What We Offer


Up to 32 days of holiday, depending on the length of service, starting with 28 days (excluding public holidays and weekends)
Mobile office with up to 40% of your total contracted hours (job and position permitting)
10 days/year of mobile office abroad in EU-countries (job and position permitting)
Language & e-learning courses
Staff discount of up to 30%
Flexible remuneration benefits (ticket restaurant, ticket transport and ticket child care (guardería))
Discounted membership for selected sports platforms & gyms
Private health insurance
Access to LinkedIn Learning
Individual support on mental health & well-being
Social Day
Employee Share Purchase Plan

Title: Procurement Excellence Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Would you like to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to enhance the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company that since 1909 has been working to improve the health and well-being of people around the world. We are leaders in plasma-derived medicines and transfusion medicine and develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 110 countries and regions.

We believe that diversity adds value to our business, our teams and our culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunities that foster an inclusive environment.

The Procurement Excellence Data Analyst supports the implementation and maintenance of procurement excellence initiatives. This role involves executing day-to-day procurement activities, ensuring compliance with established processes, and providing support to the procurement team..

What Your Responsibilities Will Be


Support procurement excellence initiatives.
Execute daily procurement activities.
Ensure compliance with established processes.
Provide support to the procurement team.
Maintain procurement records and documentation.
Assist with supplier evaluations and performance tracking.
Support the implementation of procurement software and tools.
Conduct routine audits of procurement processes.
Assist in the preparation of procurement reports and presentations.
Support contract management and negotiation activities.
Engage with suppliers to resolve any issues or discrepancies.



Functions And Tasks


Assist in the implementation of procurement initiatives.
Maintain records and documentation for procurement activities.
Ensure adherence to procurement policies and procedures.
Support the procurement team with data and analysis.
Coordinate with suppliers to resolve any issues or discrepancies.
Conduct basic market research to support procurement decisions.
Prepare procurement reports and summaries for management.
Assist in the development and maintenance of procurement databases.
Ensure compliance with ethical standards in procurement practices.
Provide administrative support to the procurement team.
Collaborate with IT for procurement systems implementation and maintenance.
Assist in developing training materials and conducting training sessions.
Monitor and track procurement performance metrics.
Ensure timely and accurate processing of procurement transactions.



Who You Are

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).


Bachelor’s degree or relevant certification in Business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in procurement or a related field.
Knowledge of procurement processes and best practices.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Good communication and team collaboration abilities..
Ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities.
Basic understanding of market research techniques.
Experience with supplier evaluation and performance tracking.
Knowledge of ethical standards in procurement practices.
Willingness to travel as required for supplier visits and training.
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to handle conflict effectively.
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
Experience with data analysis and reporting.
Strong organizational and time management skills.



What We Offer

It is a brilliant opportunity for you, Grifols is fully aware that its employees are one of its major assets. We are committed to maintaining an atmosphere that encourages all our employees to develop their professional careers in an excellent working environment.

Information about Grifols is available at www.grifols.com. If you are interested in joining our company and you have what it takes for such an exciting position, then don’t hesitate to apply!

We look forward to receiving your application!

Grifols is an equal opportunity employer.

Flexibility for U Program: Hybrid Model

Flexible schedule: Monday-Thursday 7-10 to 16-19h and Friday 8-15h.

Benefits Package

Contract of Employment: Permanent position

Location:

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Permanent, Barcelona)
Description:
Senior Data Analyst:
We are seeking a seasoned data professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment, dedicated to enhancing operational transparency and precision.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success, this is the role for you.

About the Role:
As a Senior Data & Operations Analyst, you will be at the forefront of our data management and operational control efforts. You will combine your analytical acumen with a strategic vision to optimize processes, ensuring that our data is accurate and actionable. Your expertise will be pivotal in refining our production and sales-controlling processes, enabling informed decision-making across all levels of the organization.

We need someone who can:
- Create and maintain dashboards and reporting tools to provide real-time visibility into operational performance.
- Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure operational efficiency.
- Prepare detailed reports on production and sales performance.
- Identify and implement process improvements
- Work closely with production, sales, management and the finance team to gather necessary data and insights

Key Responsibilities:

Data Management & Process Optimization:

Lead initiatives to refine processes, enhancing operational efficiency and ensuring data integrity.
Guarantee the accuracy of data sourced from various channels, ensuring reliable insights.
Develop and maintain advanced dashboards and reporting tools to offer real-time insights into operational metrics.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technological advancements to improve data analysis and control methodologies continuously.

Operational Control & Analysis:

Design and implement robust production and sales controlling processes that align with our strategic goals.
Track and analyze critical KPIs to ensure operations run efficiently and meet performance benchmarks.
Prepare comprehensive reports on production and sales metrics, pinpointing trends and identifying opportunities for improvement.

Financial Planning & Strategic Analysis:

Lead the forecasting and financial planning efforts, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business objectives.
Conduct detailed variance analyses, comparing actual results against forecasts to highlight discrepancies and opportunities.
Provide senior management with actionable insights and strategic recommendations based on data analysis.
Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication:

Collaborate closely with production, sales, finance, and management teams to collect and analyze necessary data.
Effectively communicate analytical findings and strategic recommendations to stakeholders across all levels of the organization.

Who You Are:

A data-driven professional with a passion for accuracy and transparency.
Strong analytical thinker with the ability to balance strategic goals with operational realities.
Technologically adept, with experience in the latest data management and analysis tools.

An excellent communicator who can distil complex data into clear, actionable insights for diverse audiences.

If you are ready to take on a challenging role where your skills in data and operational control will be fully utilized, apply now!

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Appodeal is a dynamic US-based product company with a truly global presence.

We have offices in Warsaw, Barcelona and Virginia along with remote team members located around the world.

Our company thrives on diversity, collaboration, and innovation, making us a leader in the mobile app monetization space.

Why Appodeal?

At Appodeal, we're more than just a company—we're a team united by a common mission: to help every person discover and grow their talents!

We take pride in our cutting-edge product and our internationally dispersed team of talented professionals.

Here's what we value, and what we hope you do too:


Continuous Learning and Growth: We are passionate about learning, growing personally, and building rewarding careers.
Making an Impact: We are committed to building a history-defining company that leaves a lasting impact on the mobile app industry.
Solving Exciting Challenges: We tackle complex problems every day, supported by a team of world-class professionals and mentors.
Enjoying the Journey: We believe in having fun while working toward our goals.


We are looking for a talented and driven Lead Data Analyst to join our AdNetwork team at AppGrowth. In this role, you will spend approximately 40% of your time providing leadership and guidance to a team of 2-3 data analysts, while dedicating the remaining 60% as an individual contributor, using your expertise to deliver impactful insights. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product, and business operations, to address all data-related needs. Your analytical skills, proficiency in Python, and expertise with pandas will be key to uncovering valuable data-driven insights that will help shape our advertising strategies and enhance the performance of our ad campaigns.

Responsibilities:


Lead and mentor a team of 2-3 mid to senior data analysts, providing guidance on data analysis techniques and best practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product, and business operations, to understand data requirements and business objectives related to advertising campaigns.
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Develop and maintain data pipelines to ensure efficient data extraction and transformation processes.
Create insightful, actionable reports and dashboards for key stakeholders to monitor and improve advertising performance metrics.
Conduct in-depth analysis of campaign data to provide actionable recommendations for improving ad targeting, bidding strategies, and overall performance.
Identify and troubleshoot data quality issues to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and advertising.


Requirements:


7+ years of experience, including 5+ years in data analysis.
2+ years of proven experience leading and mentoring a team of data analysts, or 4+ years of experience as a Senior Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python, with a solid understanding of data analysis techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
A proactive, self-driven approach to work with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Experience in the advertising industry or a strong understanding of ad network operations.


Join our innovative AdNetwork team to help shape the future of advertising through data-driven insights and impactful strategies. If you're passionate about data analysis, Python, and pandas, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply and become a key member of our dynamic team.

With an outstanding product and a mission that excites and inspires, Appodeal offers a unique opportunity to make an impact while being part of an amazing team.

Join us and help shape the future of mobile app success!
