Title: Data Analyst and Biostatistician for Traveller’s health
Description:
Descripción

The Barcelona Institute for Global Health (ISGlobal) is a cutting-edge institute addressing global public health challenges through research, translation into policy and education. ISGlobal has a broad portfolio in communicable and non-communicable diseases including environmental and climate determinants, and applies a multidisciplinary scientific approach ranging from the molecular to the population level. Research is organized in five programs: Climate, Air Pollution, Nature and Urban Health; Environment and Health over the Lifecourse; Global Viral and Bacterial Infections; Malaria and Neglected Parasitic Diseases and Maternal Child and Reproductive Health. ISGlobal is accredited with the Severo Ochoa distinction (received the first accreditation in 2019 and renewed it in 2024), a seal of excellence of the Spanish Science Ministry.

Lugar

Barcelona

What We Are Looking For

About Us: Famba is an innovative project on a mission to enhance the health and well-being of international travelers across the globe. We harness the power of AI, data analytics, and biostatistics to create cutting-edge solutions for the travel health industry. We are seeking a talented Data Analyst and Biostatistician to join our team and play a crucial role in our journey to revolutionize traveler’s health.

Position Overview: As a Data Analyst and Biostatistician at Famba, you will be at the forefront of improving the health of travelers worldwide through data-driven insights and innovative solutions. This role offers you the opportunity to combine your expertise in data analysis and biostatistics with a strong focus on data management, including data pipelines, to address the unique challenges faced by travelers and shape the future of travel health.

This is a collaboration between Hospital Clínic Department of International Health and the Biomedical Data Science Group at ISGLOBAL. As such, the candidate will be exposed to multidisciplinary research team of clinicians and data scientists.

Key Responsabilities


Data Management and Pipelines: Develop and maintain efficient data management processes, including data collection, storage, cleaning, integration, and automated data pipelines for diverse datasets related to travel health.
Workflow Optimization: Streamline data analysis workflows to ensure the efficient and timely delivery of insights and recommendations.
Data Analysis: Analyze healthcare data using advanced statistical techniques and AI algorithms to develop predictive models and recommendations for travelers' health and safety.
Data Visualization: Create compelling visualizations and reports to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders, including travelers, healthcare providers, and decision-makers.
Research Collaboration: Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, healthcare professionals, and engineers to design studies, conduct research, and develop data-driven solutions.
Quality Control: Ensure data accuracy and maintain rigorous quality control measures to uphold the integrity of healthcare data.
Data Interpretation: Interpret statistical results and provide actionable recommendations to enhance traveler health outcomes.
Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of data management processes, analysis methodologies, results, and data sources.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest developments in biostatistics, AI, data management, and travel health to drive innovation.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Biostatistics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R, SAS, or Python.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven experience in data management, ETL processes, and workflow optimization.
Experience in healthcare data analysis, epidemiology, or related fields.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex data findings effectively.
Commitment to data quality and attention to detail.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic startup environment.
Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques is a plus.


CONDITIONS


Duration: 6 months (renewable)
Starting date: January 2025
Contract: Part -time
Salary Range: Technician II-A (29.465€ gross annual)


How To Apply

Applicants must fill in the request form and include the following code reference position: DataAnalyst_Biostatistician_Nov24, attach the CV and a Cover Letter. Each attached document must be named with the candidate name and surname.

The receipt of applications will be open until the position is filled.

Only the applications submitted through the request form will be considered.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

The interviews could be placed during the reception candidatures period.

Diverse candidatures are encouraged, that includes: gender, race, ethnicity, religion, age, sexual orientation, physical abilities, and political views.

SELECTION PROCESS

The Selection Process Is Designed In Two Phases

1- Interview phase of a technical nature, with the team that requires the incorporation. To assess the person's skills and CV.

2 - Meeting with HR with the finalist(s) to finish assessing the profile and discuss contractual and institutional issues.

If needed any technical test could be pass. A Psychological Competency Evaluation Test will be required for the structural or transversal positions.

In accordance with the OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for every vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will start the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. A profile questionnaire as well as a technical exercise may be required during the process.

In ISGlobal we are committed to maintaining and developing a work environment in which the values and principles of our organization are respected and equal opportunities between women and men be promoted in each of the areas in which we operate, not tolerating discrimination based on criteria such as age, gender, marital status, race, ethnicity, functional diversity, political leanings, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

ISGlobal supports the initiative #ScienceforUkraine. Therefore, to sustain Ukraine’s presence in the European Research Area and international scholarly community, candidates from Ukraine on all levels of scholarly career are welcome: students, PhD candidates, early career researchers and senior scholars.

We confirm our commitment towards the value of the diversity of our staff and student population and seek to promote peace, equity, diversity and inclusion as essential elements in contribution to improving health worldwide.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Desde Winning Consulting estamois seleccionando unData Engineer,para el proyecto de una importante empresa multinacional para el sector financiero en Barcelona. Modelo híbrido.

Funciones:


Identificar y coordinar junto al Tech el origen de los datos necesario y establecer las necesidades de carga/ingesta de dichos datos para el modelado de trabal en datapool y disponibilidad del datos para consumo (ECIs)
Controlar la calidad del dato: homogéneos entre herramientas de visualización y cosistentes
Establecer tablas maestras o auxiliares para la categorización de datos
Establecer criterios de cálculo
Definir nuevas métricas y KPI así como la automatización para el seguimiento


Requisitos:


Titulación en Ingeniería, Business Intelligence, Matemáticas o similar
Conocimiento en herramientas de programación (SQL, Python, R, SAS) y de herramientas BI (Qlik Sense, SAS)
Nivel de inglés (mínimo B2)


¿Quiénes somos?

Winning Consulting es una empresa de consultoría que ofrece servicios de

consultoría, formación, reclutamiento e investigación. Apoyamos a nuestros clientes

en la búsqueda de soluciones innovadoras y sostenibles, desde la aplicación del

conocimiento científico a la resolución de problemas complejos de gestión hasta la

transformación digital y tecnológica de las organizaciones.

Si quieres saber más sobre nosotros, visita nuestra webhttps://www.winning-consulting.com/

Todas las candidaturas se tratan de forma confidencial en virtud del GDPR. Al enviar su candidatura, acepta el tratamiento de su información

en el contexto del reclutamiento y su inclusión en nuestra base de datos de candidatos. Si no consiente el tratamiento de estos datos, le

rogamos que no presente su candidatura a este anuncio

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Internship - Data Analyst for Sales Ops (start date Jan 2025)
Description:
What You'll Do:

Criteo is looking for a Sales Operations Data Analyst to join our Emerging EMEA Sales Strategy Team. The ideal candidate will be highly data-driven, and process-oriented, as well as an exceptional team player.

The intern will report directly to the Senior Sales Strategy Business Partner to provide support in all Sales Strategy functions across channels and countries with main focus on evaluating sales and account management performance, improving efficiency through automation and best practices sharing and leading discussions on process improvements and strategy.

Please note that this is a 6-month internship (full-time) based in Barcelona, Spain.

Key Responsibilities:


Support EMEA in all processes linked to the regular business cadence (e.g. quarterly business planning, monthly pipeline reviews) and help ensuring data accuracy in all processes.
Support weekly and monthly business performance review, challenge the teams and track progress on associated priorities
Support accurate data input and adoption of Sales Solutions and associated Sales Effectiveness Processes within the region.
Ensure data integrity of Salesforce and other Sales Solutions.
Support new business territory sizing and support new business strategy & action plan



Who You Are:


Fluent proficiency in English
Advanced Excel skills
Ideally, a strong proficiency or keen interest in technical skills such as SQL, programming languages, etc.
Interest and proficiency in analysis and statistics
Demonstrated track record of cross-functional facilitation and collaboration in a matrix organization
Ability to foster positive relationships to achieve organizational goals in a multicultural environment
Expertise in developing and implementing streamlined processes
Capacity to work autonomously, with meticulous attention to detail, and a high sense of prioritization



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analytics & BI Lead
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Fluidra es una empresa líder a nivel global en el sector de la piscina y el wellness 💦

¿Quieres conocernos?

Somos un grupo multinacional con una dilatada experiencia en el desarrollo de servicios y productos innovadores en el mercado de la piscina residencial y comercial a escala global y tenemos una misión muy clara: crear la experiencia perfecta de piscina y wellness de forma responsable.

Actualmente operamos en más de 47 países a través de filiales propias. Contamos con más de 135 delegaciones comerciales y más de 35 centros de producción alrededor del mundo, además de plataformas logísticas distribuidas estratégicamente para dar soporte tanto a los centros de producción como a los de distribución.

Nos encantaría contar contigo en nuestro equipo humano, actualmente formado por más de 7.000 personas, grandes profesionales especialistas en diferentes disciplinas.

Como Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Lead tendrás la misión de liderar el desarrollo y soporte técnico de herramientas y estrategias de digitalización.

Reportando Directamente Al Responsable Del Departamento y Trabajando De Forma Transversal Con Los Diferentes Países De La Región Serás Responsable De


Dirigir y supervisar el desarrollo y la implementación de soluciones tecnológicas que apoyen las operaciones comerciales a nivel regional.
Ofrecer soporte técnico en herramientas corporativas (Power BI, Salesforce)
Trabajar estrechamente con el resto de funciones del departamento para entender sus necesidades específicas y adaptar las soluciones tecnológicas en consecuencia, en colaboración con el departamento de IT de HQ.
Gestión de datos, generación de insights y dashboards para el negocio.
Soporte y liderazgo de la creación de plataformas B2B a nivel local coordinando recursos internos y buscando proveedores.


¿Qué esperamos de ti?


Que cuentes con formación en ingeniería de datos, informática o similar.
Que hayas desempeñado funciones similares en una organización internacional durante al menos 3 años.
Que aportes conocimiento de CRM, BI y sistemas.
Que seas una persona con excelentes dotes de comunicación e interpersonales.
Que muestres capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas.
Que tengas habilidad para trabajar de forma colaborativa en equipos cros-funcionales.
Que puedas comunicarte en español e inglés de forma fluida.


¿Qué puedes esperar tú de Fluidra?


Un equipo de profesionales que trabaja de forma colaborativa buscando la innovación y mejora continua con honestidad y pasión 💪
Un proyecto estable, con contratación indefinida y retribución flexible: tú decides si quieres destinar parte de tu retribución bruta a productos exentos de IRPF (tarjeta restaurante, transporte, guardería y seguro médico) 🚑👪🚈 🍴
Flexibilidad horaria, con jornada intensiva los viernes y todo el mes de agosto 😄
Modelo organizativo híbrido: podrás combinar la presencia en nuestras oficinas con el trabajo desde casa dos días a la semana 🏡
Oficinas ubicadas en Sant Cugat del Vallés, fácilmente accesibles en ferrocarril (Sant Joan). 🚇
Descuentos especiales en diferentes productos y servicios 🎁
Un plan de carrera a medida, con formaciones focalizadas en tus áreas de mejora y cursos online de diferentes temáticas. ¡Tú eliges en qué, cuándo y cómo formarte! 🎓


En Fluidra apostamos por el desarrollo profesional y personal de las personas. Gracias a nuestro equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados podemos cumplir con nuestra principal misión: Crear la experiencia perfecta de Piscina y Wellness de forma responsable.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (PL/SQL-Python)
Description:
Elegir Capgemini es elegir la posibilidad de dar forma a tu carrera profesional como desees. Recibirás el apoyo y la inspiración de una comunidad colaborativa de colegas de todo el mundo y podrás reinventar lo que es posible. Únete a nuestro equipo y ayuda a las principales organizaciones del mundo a descubrir el valor de la tecnología y a construir un mundo más sostenible e inclusivo. 

¿Te apetece sumarte a nosotros y participar en proyectos multisectoriales en un equipo conformado por profesionales del dato como Data Scientists, Data Engineers o Data Analysts? Nuestro objetivo es ayudar a nuestros clientes en el camino hacia la innovación continua. 

¿Qué harás en el proyecto? ¿Cuál será tu rol? 


Desarrollo, soporte y mantenimiento de las distintas iniciativas, así como la evolución de la plataforma.
Desarrollo de paquetes y procedimientos de acceso de datos.
Diseño de modelos de datos.
Optimización de rendimientos de consultas.
Creación de informes ad hoc.


Para desenvolverte bien en la posición se requieren conocimientos en/de: 


PLSQL. Con experiencia probada de entre 6 a 9 años.
Bases de datos. Especialmente de Oracle.
Ingeniería de datos con Python, para procesos de ETLs.
Perfil técnico/consultor con experiencia en Data Warehouse.
Perfil funcional y capacidad para la toma de decisiones.
Proactividad a la hora de construir soluciones y aplicar nuevas funcionalidades relacionadas con la tecnología en uso.
Inglés alto (B2/C1). Trabajamos con clientes internacionales y en muchos casos el día a día es en dicho idioma.


Requisitos Adicionales:  


Grado en Informática, Matemática, Ingeniería o similar.
Habilidades de liderazgo técnico y trabajo en equipo.  
Comunicación efectiva y proactividad con cliente.  
Capacidad y curiosidad técnica para adaptarse a cambios tecnológicos rápidos.  


Se valorará positivamente el poseer certificado de discapacidad, en el marco de nuestra política de inclusión y diversidad. 

Valoraremos todas las candidaturas. Contamos con una amplísima oferta formativa, presencial, online de Certificaciones, etc. Aunque no tengas el 100% de los conocimientos valorados ¡nos encantará conocerte! 

Nuestro compromiso con la inclusión e igualdad de oportunidades hace que tengamos un Plan de Igualdad y un Código Ético que garantizan el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección dentro de un entorno libre de discriminación por cuestión de etnia, nacionalidad, origen social, edad, orientación sexual, expresión de género, religión o cualquier otra circunstancia personal, física o social. 

¿Qué te gustará de trabajar aquí? 

Tenemos un catálogo de medidas de Desarrollo y Conciliación muy completo, como son, por ejemplo: 


Un ambiente de trabajo único muy valorado por nuestros profesionales en las evaluaciones periódicas. 
Wellbeing HUB - Incluye políticas y acciones para la salud física (Wellhub) y mental. 
24 días de vacaciones + 2 asuntos propios + 24 y 31 de diciembre + opción a comprar hasta 7 días de vacaciones al año. 
FlexAbroad: posibilidad de trabajar en remoto desde otro país durante 45 días. 
Plan de Compensación Flexible (seguro médico, transporte, formación, tarjeta restaurante o subvención de comida, guardería…). 
Formación continua, podrás disfrutar de Mylearning y de Capgemini University y de nuestros Campus Digitales y Comunidades profesionales. Tendrás acceso a plataformas como: Coursera, Udemy, Pluralsight, Harvard Manager Mentor, Education First para idiomas (inglés francés, alemán…) ¡entre otras! 
Participación en Acciones de Voluntariado y Acción Social con nuestros Grupos de Sostenibilidad, Inclusión e Igualdad. 
Acompañamiento en tus inicios con el programa de Buddies. 
Seguro de Vida y Accidentes 


¿Por qué Capgemini? 

Capgemini es líder global en transformando los negocios de los clientes aprovechando todo el poder de la tecnología. Nos guía el propósito de lograr un futuro inclusivo y sostenible a través de la tecnología y de la energía de quienes la desarrollamos. Somos una compañía responsable y diversa, líder internacional en servicios de IT e Ingeniería con más de 360.000 profesionales en más de 50 países. Con una sólida herencia de 55 años y una amplia experiencia en la industria, los clientes confían en Capgemini para abordar la totalidad de sus necesidades comerciales, desde la estrategia y el diseño hasta las operaciones, impulsadas por el rápido y novedoso mundo de la nube, los datos, la IA, la conectividad, el software, las plataformas e ingeniería digitales. El Grupo reportó en 2022 ingresos globales de €22 mil millones. 

Reescribe tu futuro. ¡Únete al equipo! 

www.capgemini.com/es-es 
Show more

Title: Workplace Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data analytics and eager to make a significant impact within a global organization? At Allianz Group, we're on a mission to revolutionize the modern workplace for our employees and partners. Our Workplace Service department is at the forefront of this transformation, managing everything from notebooks and desktops to Office 365 and virtual clients. We're building a dynamic squad focused on data analytics to enhance user experience and drive evidence-based decision-making.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll play a pivotal role in our innovative team, collaborating with various departments to harness data from multiple sources. Your expertise will help us uncover insights, identify trends, and predict future outcomes, ultimately strengthening our service delivery. If you're ready to leverage your analytical skills and lead the charge in data-driven excellence, we want to hear from you!

Join us and be a part of a forward-thinking team where your contributions will directly influence the future of workplace services at Allianz.

What you can find at Allianz Technology:


Work Life - Balance: We offer flexible working hours so you can start your working day according to your needs. In addition, during the summer and every Friday of the year, you have the option of intensive working hours, which will allow you to enjoy more free time for yourself.
International and Multicultural Environment: We value the diversity and richness that comes from working in an international and multicultural environment. With more than 52 different nationalities represented in our company, we offer our employees the opportunity to collaborate with people from all over the world, enriching the work environment and providing the opportunity to learn and grow in a truly global setting. This diversity allows us to have a broader perspective, foster creativity and innovation, and promote an inclusive work environment where every voice is heard and valued.
Professional Growth Opportunities: We are committed to the professional development of our employees and provide numerous opportunities for growth within the company. We value internal talent and promote internal advancement, offering training programs, mentoring, and skills development that allow our employees to advance in their careers.
Compensation and Benefits Package: It includes a company bonus plan, pension, employee stock program, and multiple employee discounts (details vary by location).


What will make you succeed in this position?


S trong interest in data analytics and an appetite for sharing knowledge and experience together with less senior colleagues.
Applying analytical thinking, methodological and conceptual skills to deliver valuable use cases.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess trends & potential risks and perform use case ideation to identify suitable use cases.
Be able to lead requirements ideation with stakeholders and understand stakeholder needs.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
At least 3 years of practical experience within d ata analytics with hands on experience with python
Good understanding of modern software design and development technologies, such as data lake, containers, DevOps and knowledge of cloud services such as Azure, AWS or similar
Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Technical expertise, previous experience working with data models, data mining, prediction models, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with data storage (SQL , cloud storage etc), programming ( python, SQL, PySpark etc. ) and BI tools (Power BI etc.
Higher education degree in IT, business intelligence, or comparable education


Your mission in the role will be:


Transform & enrich data from various data sources to draw a holistic view of service health, possible issues & weak points
Using statistical libraries and programming to identify, analyse, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets
Respond to data-related queries from other WPS product teams & implement them jointly
Analyze data and visualize results using Power BI and similar technologies
Research new ways to make use of the collected data (e.g., apply AI for pattern recognition)
Produce reports and charts communicating trends within data to non-specialists.
Support product teams for the root cause & impact analysis during incident and problem management process
Ideate data analytics requirements together with other WPS teams with various maturity in the data analytics area
Support Data Engineers deploy data transformation python code using cloud technologies


About Allianz Technology

Allianz Technology is the global IT service provider for Allianz and delivers IT solutions that drive the digitalization of the Group. With more than 12,000 employees located in 51 countries around the globe, Allianz Technology works together with other Allianz entities in pioneering the digitalization of the financial services industry.

We oversee the full digitalization spectrum – from one of the industry’s largest IT infrastructure projects that includes data centers, networking and security, to application platforms that span from workplace services to digital interaction. In short, we deliver full-scale, end-to-end IT solutions for Allianz in the digital age.

D&I statement

Allianz Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer encouraging diversity in the working environment. We are interested in your strengths and experience. We welcome all applications from all people regardless of gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity and cultural background, age, nationality, religion, disability, or philosophy of life.

Join us. Let´s care for tomorrow.

You. IT

62422 | Ingeniería informática y tecnológica | Profesional / Senior | Non-Executive | Allianz Technology | Jornada completa | Indefinido

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst (Oncology)
Description:
We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Life Science & Healthcare (Oncology) group in Barcelona.

The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insights generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service.

You will contribute oncology therapeutic expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global pharmaceutical customers. If you have passion for the dynamic oncology landscape and excited about the opportunity to work in the market assessment field within our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in Life Science, specially Oncology.
2 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of the oncology field is required; familiarity with clinical drug development, commercialization processes, regulatory hurdles and access is desired.
Ability to interpret data and insights and turn into compelling, quality narratives through a commercial lens is required, with excellent attention to detail.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Keen interest in becoming a therapeutic indication-specific expert.
Excellent project management skills (ability to handle multiple projects/tasks for self and to manage competing priorities to deadlines); shows autonomy with minimal oversight.
Demonstrated ability in problem solving, decision making and using sound judgement aligned with team and company’s business objectives.
Comfortable in handling large datasets and information from multiple sources; comfort in ambiguity with ability to develop rational evidence-based arguments.
Outstanding communication skills (written, presentation, oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English.
Strong interest in engaging with customers to solve their business needs.
Has a flexible, collaborative approach to work; exudes positivity and ‘can do’ attitude.


What will you be doing in this role?


Build and apply a strong understanding of disease-specific insights, including the dynamics of oncology markets, regulatory and commercial aspects of drug development and the wider pharmaceutical industry.
Critically analyze data from multiple sources (e.g., clinical trial data, commercial information, market research data) to evaluate market trends, competitive dynamics, assess opportunities and build forecasts.
Conduct primary market research via interviews and surveys with medical and healthcare experts in the oncology field, and secondary market research.
Write and produce high-quality syndicated (and custom) content independently or in collaboration with team members with minimal supervision, adhering to product specifications and timelines.
Communicate concisely and effectively disease-specific insights through multiple formats (e.g., business writing, slide decks, live presentations).
Field customer inquiries and ad hoc requests (internal and external) to high standard, showing strong grasp of complex clinical and commercial issues.
Interact effectively and efficiently with multiple stakeholders across the business (e.g., Commercial, Epidemiology, Support Services).


About The Team


We are an international and diverse team of 30 analysts and managers located in Europe, India, and the US, making up the Oncology & Biosimilars therapy team.
The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive – excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.


Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Life Science & Healthcare (Oncology) group in Barcelona.

The role comprises three broad functions: 1) market research and insights generation; 2) project management and execution; and 3) client service.

You will contribute oncology therapeutic expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global pharmaceutical customers. If you have passion for the dynamic oncology landscape and excited about the opportunity to work in the market assessment field within our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

  • PhD in Life Science, specially Oncology.
  • 2 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of the oncology field is required; familiarity with clinical drug development, commercialization processes, regulatory hurdles and access is desired.
  • Ability to interpret data and insights and turn into compelling, quality narratives through a commercial lens is required, with excellent attention to detail.

It would be great if you also had . . .

  • Keen interest in becoming a therapeutic indication-specific expert.
  • Excellent project management skills (ability to handle multiple projects/tasks for self and to manage competing priorities to deadlines); shows autonomy with minimal oversight.
  • Demonstrated ability in problem solving, decision making and using sound judgement aligned with team and company’s business objectives.
  • Comfortable in handling large datasets and information from multiple sources; comfort in ambiguity with ability to develop rational evidence-based arguments.
  • Outstanding communication skills (written, presentation, oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English.
  • Strong interest in engaging with customers to solve their business needs.
  • Has a flexible, collaborative approach to work; exudes positivity and ‘can do’ attitude.

What will you be doing in this role?

  • Build and apply a strong understanding of disease-specific insights, including the dynamics of oncology markets, regulatory and commercial aspects of drug development and the wider pharmaceutical industry.
  • Critically analyze data from multiple sources (e.g., clinical trial data, commercial information, market research data) to evaluate market trends, competitive dynamics, assess opportunities and build forecasts.
  • Conduct primary market research via interviews and surveys with medical and healthcare experts in the oncology field, and secondary market research.
  • Write and produce high-quality syndicated (and custom) content independently or in collaboration with team members with minimal supervision, adhering to product specifications and timelines.
  • Communicate concisely and effectively disease-specific insights through multiple formats (e.g., business writing, slide decks, live presentations).
  • Field customer inquiries and ad hoc requests (internal and external) to high standard, showing strong grasp of complex clinical and commercial issues.
  • Interact effectively and efficiently with multiple stakeholders across the business (e.g., Commercial, Epidemiology, Support Services).

About The Team

  • We are an international and diverse team of 30 analysts and managers located in Europe, India, and the US, making up the Oncology & Biosimilars therapy team.
  • The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive – excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.
  • A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits

  • Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
  • Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
  • Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
  • Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

OPIS, a Dow Jones company, is one of the world’s most comprehensive sources for petroleum pricing and news information.

OPIS provides real-time and historical spot, wholesale/rack, and retail fuel prices for the refined products, renewable fuels, chemicals, and natural gas and gas liquids (LPG) industries. We deliver award-winning news, market intelligence, and transparency to the refined energy marketplace and companies striving to go carbon neutral. At its core, OPIS leverages cutting-edge IT systems and tools, reliably managing vast amounts of data and providing customers with efficient business applications.

About The Team

The OPIS Data Science & Analytics team is a collaborative group of Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Data Engineers dedicated to tackling intricate data challenges. Our team leverages extensive industry knowledge, robust analytical skills, and a practical approach to address our organization's most complex business dilemmas.

About The Role

As a Lead Data Analyst, you'll lead our efforts in harnessing the power of data and analysis to deliver actionable insights. Through advanced visualizations, precise report presentations, and captivating data narratives, you'll drive informed decision-making and uncover valuable insights that propel our organization forward. Join us in shaping the future of data-driven initiatives within our team.

You Will


Work closely with OPIS Product Management and other Business teams to steer business requirements and lead the development of analytics visualizations and customer-facing dashboards
Gain an in-depth understanding of all OPIS data sources and design advanced data models tailored to complex analytics needs
Conduct deep-dive investigations and leverage advanced analytics techniques using BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker to create complex visualizations and dashboards, and define metrics
Communicate insights clearly to tell a compelling business story; Perform strategic analysis to identify new business opportunities.
Effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and collaborate with agile product teams on data discovery, cleansing, mapping, profiling, mining, and modeling


You Have


Degree in data analytics, or related technical field or equivalent experience
4+ years of industry experience in data analytics
Strong analytical skills, proficient in SQL and Python programming
Expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Expertise in design and development of data modeling for BI tools
Strong experience with qualitative and quantitative methods, trend and cross-sectional data, and data integration to achieve project goals
Strong understanding of statistics and their application to business problems
Strong business acumen and ability to handle complex business requirements
Leadership abilities in complex analytical projects
Ability to work independently and collaboratively, focusing on high-quality results
Passionate about telling data stories through visualization and dashboard
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and precision
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (data science, statistics, finance, mathematics, engineering, or related)
Strong understanding of web analytics tools is a plus
Must speak and write in English fluently; Effective communicator


Our Benefits


Pension Scheme: Company contributes up to 8% of your salary with matching contributions
Healthcare Coverage: Comprehensive health plan with unlimited coverage, including outpatient care, dental, and maternity
Life & Disability Insurance: Coverage from day one, including life insurance at 2X salary and accident coverage up to 4X salary
Wellness Programs: Access to wellness platforms, mindfulness apps, and free fitness classes
Meal & Teleworking Allowance: Monthly meal card and teleworking allowance
Flexible Working: Ability to work from home 2 days per week with the option to work remotely for 1 week per quarter
Family Care Support: Up to 4 weeks of paid compassionate leave and a generous reimbursement for emergency care
Referral Bonus: Earn a bonus for recommending great talent to join us.


Current Colleagues

If you are currently employed by Dow Jones, please apply internally via the Workday internal careers site.

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - OPIS

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por ofrecerte las mejores oportunidades dentro del área tecnológica. Contamos con un equipo de más de 950 profesionales. Ser parte de nuestro equipo significa formar parte de una comunidad multicultural, con acceso a oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional, generando impacto.

Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en un entorno internacional, apostando por trabajar en soluciones de I+D tanto en Ingeniería como en IT, ¡este es tu próximo destino!




Buscamos un/a Data Engineer para trabajar con uno de nuestros principales clientes del sector industrial.




¿Qué haré?

Estas serán tus funciones principales:

Diseñar y optimizar flujos de datos utilizando Databricks.
Implementar procesos ETL en entornos cloud.
Utilizar SQL para consultas avanzadas y la creación de modelos de datos escalables.
Colaborar con equipos para garantizar datos de calidad y soluciones fiables.




¿Cómo lo haré?

Tendrás horario flexible.
Contarás con un PC y los periféricos necesarios para el desarrollo de tu trabajo.
Trabajarás en formato híbrido en las oficinas de cliente en Sant Cugat del Vallès.




Requisitos:

Más de 2 años de experiencia en ingeniería de datos.
Conocimientos en Databricks, Spark y lenguajes como Python o Scala.
Experiencia con ETLs, bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales (SQL/NoSQL).
Dominio de SQL como lenguaje clave para la gestión, consulta y análisis de datos.
Familiaridad con plataformas en la nube (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Inglés conversacional fluido.




Beneficios de trabajar con nosotros en BETWEEN:

🩺 Cuidado y bienestar: Seguro médico con Sanitas.

📚 Formación y desarrollo: Idiomas, Udemy, certificaciones, The Power Business School, y bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).

☕ Acompañamiento personalizado: Equipo de Talento a tu disposición y cafés mensuales para mantener el contacto.

💼 Proyectos desafiantes: Retos alineados con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.

💰 Flexibilidad salarial: Ventajas fiscales con Retribución Flexible (restauración, transporte, guardería).

🏋️ Vida activa: Descuentos en Gympass para fitness.

🛍️ Descuentos exclusivos: Acceso al Club Inspiring Benefits.

🤝 Networking y eventos: BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa y más.

🏢 Oficinas espectaculares: En el 22@, con rooftop, tirador de cerveza, ping-pong y futbolín.

💵 Recompensa por recomendar talento: Programa de recomendación remunerado.




En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.

Title: Apprentice P&B CX Digital & Data Analyst
Description:
Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

Are you ready to dive into a dynamic and innovative environment where your ideas matter?

We are in search of a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual to provide valuable contribution to our Customer Experience community supporting continuous improvement projects in different areas: process efficiency, communication, digitalization, analytics ....

Your key responsibilities


Drive analysis and identify opportunities to improve customer experience; both qualitative/quantitative data
Performance Management: support on analytics and insights
Engage with the main stakeholders to capture insights (e.g. Commercial, Regional owners,…)
Project Management: participate and support on key projects (CRM, …)
.you'll collaborate with our digital and tech experts.
Provide support on Customer Experience efficiency programs
To define actions plans for continuous improvement the customer experience


We bring


Opportunity to have a first work experience where to learn, share your ideas and propose new things
High challenge environment
Join a super team and be active member of the transformation journey
A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome
An eagerness to be one team and learn from each other to bring progress to life and create a better future
The opportunity to work for a company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose
1 year Apprenticeship Contract


You bring


Individual that embraces multiculturalism and diversity
Strong communication skills in English in both written and verbal communication.
Passionate about digitalisation tool and data analytics.
Advanced level of Excel, PowerBi or other data visualization tools, MS Office applications. SAP Knowledge is a plus
Familiarity with SharePoint concepts like sites, lists, libraries, permissions, etc.
Proficiency in navigating and using the SharePoint interface
Creative, open-minded, and willing to learn attitude
Excellent communication skills and team spirit.


Dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

Title: Revenue Insight Analyst Italy - Internship 6 months - Barcelona
Description:
This year marks 10 years since we launched the idea that it is possible to simplify our customers' lives by offering an innovative solution that allows them to easily subscribe to, manage, and switch all types of contracts via a unique and intuitive platform.

In the meantime, we have supported more than 1.5 million customers in France, Spain, and Italy, while investing in new verticals, positioning ourselves as a highly efficient, innovative, and competitive scale-up in a rapidly growing market.

With over 900 employees spread across 3 locations, we are consolidating our position as a market leader in Europe. We are always on the lookout for talent ready to join a dedicated and motivated team driven by a meaningful project. Working with us means embracing a culture of excellence, innovation, and real impact.

As Revenue Insight Analyst, you will be a critical member of our Offer & Revenue team and act as the right-hand to our Head of Offer & Revenue (Spain and Italy), focused on delivering actionable insights to drive business performance. Using tools like Excel and SQL, you will analyze data to answer key questions about channel conversion, customer behavior, and retention trends.

You will interact with division heads and our supplier partners across the Energy, Telco, and Insurance verticals. The missions are very diverse and will range from strategic planning to operational optimisation, requiring analytical focus as well as interpersonal skills. They demand strong commitment, in exchange for which you will learn about many topics! 




Your responsibilities : 
Strategy:

Strategic analyses of our portfolio, business funnels and offer strategy
Coordination and monitoring of the commercial roadmap
Development of partnerships (contact, financial analysis, contract negotiations)
Deep-dive analytics to ensure consistency and completeness of our BI data



Data

Analyze large datasets to understand business performance and identify actionable trends.
Use SQL and Excel to answer questions about conversion rates, lead performance, and customer retention patterns.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs and support decision-making.



Operations:

Collaborate in optimizing operational setup with suppliers (e.g., relay with our Ops/Tech team for back-office setup & integration as well as automation tools for sales tracking)
In-site supplier launch and follow-up/improvement of operational performance (scripting, process optimization, designing training materials)
Assist the Offer & Revenue Manager and the Head of Operations on the Spanish roadmap
And much more according to papernest's needs and your desires!





Your profile : 
Currently studying in an Engineering or Business school
Fluent/native in Italian and proficient in English
Initiative, enthusiasm, team player
Strong analytical skills (you master Excel and can work well with SQL)
Strong problem-solving abilities and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Interest in Data, Strategy and Operations
What we offer :

Evolve in an international and inclusive environment: everyone has a place at papernest, and with more than 46 different nationalities, it's not uncommon here to start a sentence in English and finish it en français o en español ¡


💸 Compensation & partnerships: your talent deserves to be rewarded! Enjoy a competitive compensation for your internship. We value every contribution and are committed to offering attractive remuneration for your efforts and dedication. Also, with your papernest badge, you will have access to various partner services (restaurants, wellness centers, mobility...).

🍽️ Meals: a healthy and balanced breakfast is offered every Tuesday!

📈 Career Development: at our company, interns are not just “photocopy-coffee” assistants! As a full-fledged team member, you're here to learn, but also to share your ideas and implement projects. You'll be supported throughout your journey to maximize your skills and prepare for your future.

✨Remote Work: enjoy 1 day of remote work per week to optimize your focus and efficiency.




Hriring process: 
A first interview with Ava, Talent Acquisition Partner (30 min)
An Excel Test (1 hour, in autonomy). This test is designed to assess your analytical and problem-solving skills, essential for this role.
An interview with Antonio, Head of Offer & Revenue Spain and Italy (and your future Manager!) (1h)
Final call with Arthur, Director of O&R (30 min)




Interested in this challenge? 🙂

Then don't hesitate any longer; we look forward to meeting you! Regardless of your age, gender, background, religion, sexual orientation, or disability, you have a place with us. Our selection processes are designed to be inclusive, and our work environment is adapted for everyone.

We particularly encourage applications from women. Even if you feel that you do not meet all the criteria outlined in this job posting, know that every application is valuable. We firmly believe that diverse and varied backgrounds enrich our team. We will carefully consider your application, as parity and diversity are essential assets for our success.


Show more
HTML:
This year marks 10 years since we launched the idea that it is possible to simplify our customers' lives by offering an innovative solution that allows them to easily subscribe to, manage, and switch all types of contracts via a unique and intuitive platform.

In the meantime, we have supported more than 1.5 million customers in France, Spain, and Italy, while investing in new verticals, positioning ourselves as a highly efficient, innovative, and competitive scale-up in a rapidly growing market.

With over 900 employees spread across 3 locations, we are consolidating our position as a market leader in Europe. We are always on the lookout for talent ready to join a dedicated and motivated team driven by a meaningful project. Working with us means embracing a culture of excellence, innovation, and real impact.

As Revenue Insight Analyst, you will be a critical member of our Offer & Revenue team and act as the right-hand to our Head of Offer & Revenue (Spain and Italy), focused on delivering actionable insights to drive business performance. Using tools like Excel and SQL, you will analyze data to answer key questions about channel conversion, customer behavior, and retention trends.

You will interact with division heads and our supplier partners across the Energy, Telco, and Insurance verticals. The missions are very diverse and will range from strategic planning to operational optimisation, requiring analytical focus as well as interpersonal skills. They demand strong commitment, in exchange for which you will learn about many topics! 


Your responsibilities : 
    Strategy:
    • Strategic analyses of our portfolio, business funnels and offer strategy
    • Coordination and monitoring of the commercial roadmap
    • Development of partnerships (contact, financial analysis, contract negotiations)
    • Deep-dive analytics to ensure consistency and completeness of our BI data


    Data
    • Analyze large datasets to understand business performance and identify actionable trends.
    • Use SQL and Excel to answer questions about conversion rates, lead performance, and customer retention patterns.
    • Build and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs and support decision-making.


    Operations:
    • Collaborate in optimizing operational setup with suppliers (e.g., relay with our Ops/Tech team for back-office setup & integration as well as automation tools for sales tracking)
    • In-site supplier launch and follow-up/improvement of operational performance (scripting, process optimization, designing training materials)
    • Assist the Offer & Revenue Manager and the Head of Operations on the Spanish roadmap
    • And much more according to papernest's needs and your desires!



Your profile : 
  • Currently studying in an Engineering or Business school
  • Fluent/native in Italian and proficient in English
  • Initiative, enthusiasm, team player
  • Strong analytical skills (you master Excel and can work well with SQL)
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
  • Interest in Data, Strategy and Operations
What we offer :

Evolve in an international and inclusive environment: everyone has a place at papernest, and with more than 46 different nationalities, it's not uncommon here to start a sentence in English and finish it en français o en español ¡

💸 Compensation & partnerships: your talent deserves to be rewarded! Enjoy a competitive compensation for your internship. We value every contribution and are committed to offering attractive remuneration for your efforts and dedication. Also, with your papernest badge, you will have access to various partner services (restaurants, wellness centers, mobility...).

🍽️ Meals: a healthy and balanced breakfast is offered every Tuesday!

📈 Career Development: at our company, interns are not just “photocopy-coffee” assistants! As a full-fledged team member, you're here to learn, but also to share your ideas and implement projects. You'll be supported throughout your journey to maximize your skills and prepare for your future.

✨Remote Work: enjoy 1 day of remote work per week to optimize your focus and efficiency.


Hriring process: 
  • A first interview with Ava, Talent Acquisition Partner (30 min)
  • An Excel Test (1 hour, in autonomy). This test is designed to assess your analytical and problem-solving skills, essential for this role.
  • An interview with Antonio, Head of Offer & Revenue Spain and Italy (and your future Manager!) (1h)
  • Final call with Arthur, Director of O&R (30 min)


Interested in this challenge? 🙂

Then don't hesitate any longer; we look forward to meeting you! Regardless of your age, gender, background, religion, sexual orientation, or disability, you have a place with us. Our selection processes are designed to be inclusive, and our work environment is adapted for everyone.

We particularly encourage applications from women. Even if you feel that you do not meet all the criteria outlined in this job posting, know that every application is valuable. We firmly believe that diverse and varied backgrounds enrich our team. We will carefully consider your application, as parity and diversity are essential assets for our success.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST & DATA ANALIST_COE ATM
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

Es necesaria la incorporación de un Product manager para el Centro de Excelencia de ATMs (CoE ATM) del área COSTUMER EXPERIENCE ubicado en Barcelona. El puesto de trabajo a cubrir se ubica en un equipo de trabajo que tiene como objetivo diseñar e implementar herramientas analíticas de seguimiento que permiten a COE ATM, entre otros stakeholders, hacer una monitorización efectiva de las funcionalidades, la calidad, evolución del parque y comportamiento de los cajeros.Así mismo este equipo tiene la función de asegurar la disponibilidad de los datos en el entorno corporativo necesarios para la gestión y toma de decisiones del COE ATM. 

 

Funciones y responsabilidades:

 

A nivel de Project Management / Product Management:

 

Gestión y priorización del backlog de cuadros de mando y/o herramientas analíticas, garantizando la alineación con los objetivos del equipo y retos de la entidad
Coordinación con los principales stakeholders: áreas de negocio/producto, UX, tecnología, BI y diseñadores (UI)
Obtención de insights y/o casos de uso en colaboración con el área de Usabilidad (UX)
Definición de los requerimientos técnicos y funcionales (historias de usuarios), participando también en la definición, revisión y ejecución de las pruebas
Seguimiento del nivel de uso de las herramientas implantadas y de la satisfacción de los usuarios, así como el plan de acción y estrategia de promoción de las nuevas herramientas a nivel de la red de comercial de la entidad y/o usuarios (gestores)
Coordinación con el equipo de analítica interna (Advanced Analytics) para industrializar nuevas lógicas de cálculo basadas en grandes volúmenes de datos y algoritmos complejos.

 

A nivel de disponibilidad y calidad de los datos:

 

Identificación y coordinación con Tech del origen de los datos necesarios y establecer las necesidades de carga/ingesta de dichos datos para modelado de tablas en datapool y disponibilidad del dato para consumo (ECIs)
Controles de calidad del dato: homogéneos entre herramientas de visualización y consistentes.
Establecer tablas maestras o auxiliares para la categorización de datos
Establecer criterios de cálculo
Definir nuevas métricas y kpi así como la automatización para el seguimiento  

 

Dependencia: Director de ATMs

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulados en Ingeniería, Business Intelligence, Matemáticas, o similar.
Experiencia como Product Management y/o Project Management en entornos analíticos valorándose experiencia en iniciativas de experiencia cliente en entornos digitales. 
Conocimiento en herramientas de programación (SQL, Python, R, SAS) y de herramientas BI (QlikSense, SAS). 
Nivel Avanzado en suite MS Office (Excel, PPT y Word).
Experiencia desarrollando Business Cases
Experiencia en ciencias de datos, modelización y clustering
Conocimientos necesarios para almacenar y explotar información para desarrollo de negocio
Valorable conocimiento Tealium (tag manager)
Valorable experiencia previa en modelo de seguimiento de experiencia y feedback de los clientes, siendo capaz de identificar mejoras en las operativas y en los servicios de la entidad gracias a escuchar la voz del cliente
Valorable experiencia previa en entornos financieros o banca, en consultoría en proyectos similares de transformación digital, demostrando conocimiento sobre el ecosistema digital y sobre las últimas tendencias
Buena capacidad analítica y de resolución de problemas.
Nivel de inglés (mínimo B2)
Competencias clave

 

Actitud proactiva y capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de forma transversal. 
Alto nivel de creatividad, iniciativa y autonomía, siendo capaz de liderar y gestionar las iniciativas bajo su responsabilidad 
Orientación al detalle y con capacidad de priorización y coordinación de varios proyectos.
Resiliencia y capacidad de adaptación a entornos cambiantes y de alta criticidad.
Flexibilidad para trabajar con autonomía con calendarios ajustados.  
¿Qué ofrecemos?

 

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

  • Orientación al detalle y con capacidad de priorización y coordinación de varios proyectos.
  • Resiliencia y capacidad de adaptación a entornos cambiantes y de alta criticidad.
  • Flexibilidad para trabajar con autonomía con calendarios ajustados.  
¿Qué ofrecemos?

 

  • Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
  • Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
  • Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
  • Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
  • Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Junior Data Engineer




Position Overview

Our Mission is “Health for all and Hunger for none” Every day, we are privileged to work on purposeful cutting-edge projects to bring our mission to life. Join us to have a career that you can put your passion into practice and make an impact using Science for a better life , join the global team of Crop BI as a Junior Data Engineer.




Key Tasks & Responsibilities

• Develops and implements accurate, consistent, and secure data sets supporting key Business Intelligence Team internal metrics

• Leverages baseline understanding of defined Business Intelligence Team’s internal metrics to develop and manage tracking mechanisms.

• Develops and maintains the necessary data and documentation to understand the data elements, respective sources, expected range of answers.

• Works with BI Team members to maintain a data repository, regular reporting, and ad-hoc reporting for Business Intelligence Team internal metrics

• Analyzes data for opportunities and coordinates data quality problem solving efforts

• Monitors existing, regular, data validity mechanisms to detect data quality gaps.

• Leverages and coordinates expertise of system and database subject matter experts to solve data quality deficiencies.

• Understands and leverages common definitions of cross functional and cross brand metrics and calculations.

• Collaboratively builds business and data knowledge and solutions

• Works with IT Data Stewards and Data Support Teams to understand business rules behind available data to enable proper interpretation for metrics and problem-solving facilitation.

• Uses business acumen and functional stakeholder input to understand data needed for process enablement, to locate the needed data, and to translate to the right measures at the right granularity to answer the question being asked with appropriate presentation.

• Works both independently and collaboratively with a team of peers to fully satisfy stakeholder and team data needs

• Creates and Delivers Change Management Plans

• Builds strong working relationships with Supply Chain Management and Commercial data consumers to understand

the link between data requests and business process decisions.

• Understands and leverages basic change management concepts and processes to develop change management plans designed to shorten acceptance and learning curves for new and changing business intelligence solutions.

• Uses interpersonal skills to deliver the planned communications and training to the target audiences for new and changed business intelligence solutions.




Qualifications & Competencies

• Minimum Bachelor’s Degree; Business Intelligence, Data Science, Computer Science, or Engineering degree preferred.

• 1+ years of experience working with data (e.g., Finance, Data Warehousing, Data Analytics, Reporting), or a Masters degree in related field (e.g., Business Intelligence, Data Science, Analytics); Ag Industry and/or supply chain knowledge strongly preferred;

• Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills in the data arena. Preferred: experience working with data in relational databases using SQL or equivalent

• Demonstrated technical competency of organizing and facilitating problem solving in a group environment & demonstrated project coordination experience.

• Business acumen in the area of relating data to business process drivers and performance management. Tailors communication appropriately to both business and IT audiences.

• Collaborative team-focused delivery experience

• Preferred: experience leveraging one or more tools in the Business Intelligence space (e.g., Tableau, SAP Business Objects Webi, Web FOCUS, QlikView, Microsoft BI, Microstrategy, Cognos, Alteryx, Paxata, Trifacta, Informatica, Talend, Ascential) or with data analysis/reporting using standard business tools (e.g., Advanced Excel, Advanced Microsoft Access)




Required System Skills

• Proven experience as a BI Developer (Reporting and Data)

• SQL experience (Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata)

• Strong background in Reporting Tools: SAP Business Objects/Webi, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikView or equivalent (e.g., Power BI, Cognos, MicroStrategy)

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions and Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our AXSI team, you'll be at the forefront of measurement and experimentation. Your role will be crucial in helping our clients understand and maximise their return on investment while driving innovation in the rapidly evolving digital advertising landscape.


Incrementality measurement: Enable advertisers to quantify and understand the true value of Criteo's solutions through sophisticated measurement methodologies
Client Consultations: Partner with advertisers to deeply understand their business objectives and define meaningful success metrics for their advertising investments
Experimentation Design: Craft and implement robust testing strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and business context
Analysis & Communication: Transform complex experimental data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients
Measurement Innovation: Contribute to our suite of measurement tools, enabling teams across Criteo to evaluate and optimise their initiatives
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges
Solid foundation in statistical inference methodologies and experience in designing and analysing A/B tests
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies
Ability to synthesise complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Analyst BU SEMEA M/F
Description:
At the heart of a Group where every job has a meaning, we're looking for our future Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Analyst BU SEMEA M/F in Barcelona, Spain. 📍🌍




At Petit Forestier Group, every employee is a talent. Through your expertise and skills, you'll help us to improving quality of life by mastering the cold chain. 🚛❄




Why join us? 🚀

A dynamic and stimulating environment within the Group, with the ambition of becoming the world leader in sustainable refrigerated rental.
A dynamic team ready to take on new challenges every day.
Opportunities for development and continuous training, through an integrated E-Learning tool.




What will the role be about 💥

Develop visually appealing and effective PowerPoint presentations tailored to the needs of executive committees and other key audiences.
Analyze and synthesize large volumes of data, converting it into comprehensible visualizations using Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Qlik, or other data visualization tools.
Collaborate closely with the BU Director and cross-functional teams to understand presentation goals and expectations, ensuring alignment with specific audiences.
Create impactful charts, tables, and infographics to facilitate the understanding of complex data and enhance the visual narrative.
Ensure all presentations align with corporate identity and brand standards.
Stay updated on best practices in presentation design and data visualization trends.
Prepare and edit content in English and French, adapting language and style to the audience and context.
Prepare reports, briefings, and confidential documents.
Provide support to both external and internal clients of the company.
Collaborate on internal projects.




Who are we looking for (must have / nice to have) 💥

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in finance, data analysis, related fields, communications, or a similar role.
Previous experience in financial and business data analysis and creating presentations for executive committees or high-level audiences.
Advanced proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel; good knowledge of data visualization software (Power BI/Qlik).
Analytical skills: data analysis, interpretation, visualization, and dashboard/KPI management.
Proficiency in English and French, both written and spoken (Cambridge level C1 or C2).
Ability to analyze complex data and present it clearly and effectively.
Creative approach with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects efficiently.
Proactive and flexible attitude, with the ability to work under pressure.
Creativity and proactivity in contributing innovative ideas and practical solutions.
Graphic design experience is a plus.
High discretion and the ability to handle confidential information.




What are we offering (benefits) 💥

We offer you a varied and versatile full-time position in a friendly team with a competitive salary. You will join a fast-growing company with committed employees and a family atmosphere.

Are you enthusiastic, reliable, technically skilled and do you recognize yourself in this position? Then we look forward to receiving your application!

Competitive salary
Holiday pay
Home Office Policy
Free parking
Career opportunities
Training opportunities
Birthday off
Fresh Fruits at the Office




You'll be part of a team that embodies the Group's values: passion, service, commitment and agility.




All our positions are open to the recruitment of disabled workers. 👩‍💼👨‍💼




Petit Forestier Group, a profession that makes sense. 💼
