Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Información clave:

Equipo: Comunicación / Marca

Localización: Madrid, España

Nivel de experiencia: +2 años

Tipo de trabajo: híbrido

Requisitos: inglés B2 o superior + Licenciatura o superior

El equipo al que te unes:

La vacante está dentro la D. Performance, Inteligencia de Negocio y Modelo Operativo de la D.E. Movilidad Iberia.

En la Dirección Ejecutiva de Movilidad Iberia, somos responsables de la gestión y desarrollo de estrategias para la movilidad en la región ibérica. Este puesto jugará un papel vital en apoyar a la Dirección de Movilidad Iberia en su misión de optimizar la gestión y estrategia de movilidad, asegurando que las decisiones se basen en datos precisos y análisis profundos.

Principales tareas:


Serás responsable de interpretar datos y aplicar métodos estadísticos para resolver problemas de negocio complejos.
Construirás modelos analíticos utilizando plataformas de análisis de datos para apoyar la toma de decisiones.
Utilizarás tus conocimientos para automatizar tareas y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos.
Colaborarás estrechamente con diferentes áreas de la empresa para alinear el análisis de datos con los objetivos estratégicos.
Manejarás plataformas de Business Intelligence para la visualización de datos y generación de insights.
Asegurarás la calidad y el correcto manejo de los datos dentro de la organización, manteniendo altos estándares de seguridad del dato.



Qué ofrecemos:


Contrato indefinido
Bonus según objetivos
Seguro médico
Aportación a plan de pensiones
Desconexión digital
Medidas de conciliación
Asesoría legal
Servicios de apoyo al empleado



Encajarás en el puesto si:


Tienes estudios en áreas relacionadas con la ciencia de datos, estadística, matemáticas, informática, ingeniería o econometría.
Experiencia demostrable en análisis de datos y visualización.
Conocimientos avanzados en plataformas de Business Intelligence y herramientas de análisis estadístico. Se valorará positivamente experiencia en PowerBI y DAX.
Experiencia de trabajo en la nube. Se valorará positivamente experiencia en el ecosistema Azure.
Fuerte comprensión de los procesos de negocio y capacidad para traducir necesidades empresariales en requerimientos analíticos.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación para compartir hallazgos con audiencias técnicas y no técnicas.
Capacidad de resolver problemas de negocio con analítica de datos.

Title: Junior Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
About The Job


As Chief Operating Officer (COO) team, we assist our different business team in multiple topics, both on daily/monthly needs as in project mode. Within the COO team we have a small team of data scientists focusing on data, who are involved in the data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery.
We are looking for a junior business data analyst to join the COO team to provide assistance in the automation of our business monitoring reports and enhance and leverage our data capabilities.


Your Main Activities Are


Automate business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team´s data analysts
Report to Top line TB Management and TB COO on all data queries and data needs.
Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making
Meet different stakeholders to frame their data needs, based on your findings collect the necessary data, process the data, and turn it into meaningful tools meeting the requirements expressed by the teams
Participate and interact with inter-disciplinary teams (IT, Business, Operations) and contribute to the improvement and streamlining of data systems within the company to drive innovation


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, Business Intelligence, Business, Economics or Mathematics
Fluency in English
Highly proficient with MS Excel
Ability to quickly comprehend new software tools and learn how to use them optimally
Great attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal, communication and influence skills
Good conceptualization skills and data exposure
Open, curious and eager to learn and discover day to day banking products


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A SynchroTech recruta Data Analyst para cliente no setor energético, localizado na região de Lisboa.

FUNÇÃO

  • Realizar análise e modelação de dados em ambientes de Data Warehouse, garantindo a organização e qualidade dos dados;
  • Criar User Stories para projetos relacionados ao Data Warehouse, facilitando o entendimento entre equipas técnicas e de negócio;
  • Extrair, transformar e analisar dados adhoc provenientes de sistemas comerciais e analíticos, gerando insights relevantes para a tomada de decisão;
  • Trabalhar com SQL para consultas e manipulação de dados, e com Excel avançado para elaboração de relatórios e análises;
  • Colaborar com equipas multidisciplinares, aplicando pensamento analítico e criatividade para resolver problemas complexos e propor soluções inovadoras.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Lisboa.
  • 40h/semanais.
  • Regime híbrido (1x por semana/ 1x de 15 em 15 dias).

REQUISITOS

  • Até 5 anos de experiência.
  • Conhecimento em linguagem SQL, ferramentas Office e em particular Excel nível avançado.
  • Capacidade analítica e de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, criatividade, iniciativa e proatividade são as competências que privilegiamos.
  • Experiência em criação de User Stories para o Data Warehouse.
  • Experiência em modelação de dados no Data Warehouse.
  • Experiência em Levantamento de dados adhoc provenientes de sistemas comerciais e/ou analíticos.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Vencimento Mensal;
  • Regime híbrido;
  • Subsídio de Alimentação;
  • Formação contínua;
  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Dias de férias extra;
  • Apoio em formações e desenvolvimento profissional;
  • Seguro de vida.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

SynchroTech by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Your responsibilities:


  • Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
  • Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
  • Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
  • Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
  • Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.


Our requirements:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
  • Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
  • Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English


What we offer:


  • Challenges in an international environment
  • Career development opportunities
  • Internal training catalogue
  • Permanent contract
  • Private medical care
  • Comprehensive onboarding program
  • Buddy
  • Scandinavian work culture
  • Work-life balance
  • Culture of feedback
  • Work schedule 35h/week
  • Hybrid and flexible work
  • Good access to public transports


DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Data Analyst - Trainee Collections & Recoveries
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localização: Lisboa

Descrição Geral da Função

A Área de Collection and Recoveries está a procurar um Trainee para reforçar a sua equipa com um perfil de Data Analytics, que trabalhará sob a supervisão do Manager da área.

Principais Responsabilidades


Usar ferramentas de exploração, tratamento e extração de dados de diferentes fontes (principalmente SAS e SQL Developer);
Desenhar e criar dashboards para melhorar a visualização de dados e KPI’s que deem suporte as decisões e estratégias de negócio a implementar;
Capacidade analítica e interpretação de dados para construir estatísticas que permitam ao negócio tomar decisões ponderadas e sustentadas;
Colaborar com as áreas de negócio para a partilha de informação e discussão que envolvam dados e as suas fontes de informação;
Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação de negócio relacionadas com as carteiras de crédito e a recuperação de crédito para diferentes segmentos de clientes;


Requisitos


Percurso académico em Matemática, Estatística, Econometria, Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou semelhante
Conhecimentos de exploração e análise de dados (SAS Guide, SQL, Python, R ou semelhante);
Bons conhecimentos de MS-Office, nomeadamente Excel e PowerPoint;
Idiomas: Inglês (valoriza-se conhecimentos em Espanhol).
Perfil técnico com forte capacidade de otimização processos de extração de informação adaptadas aos requisitos de negócio
Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas
Autonomia, rigor, proatividade e orientação para resultados
Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders
Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo


Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ComparaJá.pt

ComparaJá.pt is a free and independent online comparison platform for financial services and products, with a clear mission: to help people saving time and money, in a quick and simple comparison tool.

Our goal is for Portuguese consumers to make informed and conscious financial decisions. For this, we provide a free, impartial, thorough and independent platform, where people can compare the various financial providers in the Portuguese market for home loans, personal loans, credit cards, telecommunication and energy providers, life insurance and saving accounts.

We are the #1 personal finance platform in Portugal for the users, our partners and media channels. We are part of Samlino Group, a European Investment Company that helps Europeans save time and money by making better choices about insurance, home services and banking products. In Europe, our sister companies are: Samlino.dk (Denmark), VertaaEnsin.fi (Finland), TopCompare.be & Tariefchecker.be (Belgium), and Pricefox.gr (Greece).

What You'll Do


You will support expansion and daily operations, analyzing marketing trends and participating in strategic projects.
You will be responsible and have full ownership of analytical work, with direct reporting to one of our Managing Directors.
You will collaborate with the different Marketing Teams (SEO, PR, paid social, Search), Product and Operational teams, being the point of contact for the key projects you are leading.
You will cooperate within a multicultural and multidisciplinary team developing and improving processes, with direct contact with the Group leadership team in London.


What We Expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:


Have acquired a bachelor or master's degree with outstanding results in Management, Marketing, Economics, Finance or another related field. Financial knowledge is a plus.
You are knowledgeable in MS Office and analytical tools. SQL knowledge is a plus.
You have a strong sense of ownership and initiative and a genuine interest in learning and act on the desire.
You have a strong affinity for critical thinking, analytical, hands-on execution, problem-solving, and result-orientation.
You have an EU work permit.
Plus: You are passionate about Marketing and Management, with a taste for Finance.


What We Offer


A workplace with great talents and leaders that will inspire and challenge you daily.
Responsibility for high impact projects that constantly push you out of your comfort zone and give you the opportunity to be the best you can.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Assume responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day.
Work on exciting and challenging projects and create an impact with new, innovative ideas.
Grow personally and professionally from working both independently and as part of an international group.
Work with and learn from experts and mentors in diverse fields.
Create strong and meaningful connections with your team members at exciting company events.
Be part of one of the most promising Portuguese fintech startups, with one goal in mind: help the Portuguese people saving money.
Show more

Title: Data Driven | Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.

Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.


Qualifications


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Analytics

Employment Type: Contract

Location: Remote

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale’s, use Tabby’s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You’ll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data — extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple’s ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google’s Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • Minimum 5 years' experience in a similar role (extracting OLTP data from a company data warehouse);
  • Experience in the Policy & Claims Insurance area;
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL and of concepts and structures for Data Storage Architectures, ETL and BI;
  • Knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g. SQL Server, DB2), with experience in creating DDL;
  • Fluent English.

Title: Product Data Analyst – Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localização: Lisboa

Descrição Geral da Função

We are looking for an experienced and data-driven Product Data Analyst to join our Digital Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and a strong analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through dashboards and reporting tools.

Principais Responsabilidades


User interaction Analysis: Analyze web and app usage data to uncover trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.
Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate opportunities.
Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.
Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key success metrics for new features and initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure impact, and optimize product performance.
Dashboard Creation: Develop and maintain dashboards for continuous monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into performance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the product lifecycle.
Tool Optimization: Act as a subject matter expert in Google Analytics 4, ensuring best practices are followed and providing training or guidance to team members as needed.


Requisitos


Experience: 2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a fintech, digital product, or SaaS environment.
Analytics Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and familiarity with other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights and present findings effectively to stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex problems using data.
A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product hypotheses and feature performance.
Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.


Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

  • Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate opportunities.
  • Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.
  • Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key success metrics for new features and initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
  • A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure impact, and optimize product performance.
  • Dashboard Creation: Develop and maintain dashboards for continuous monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into performance.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the product lifecycle.
  • Tool Optimization: Act as a subject matter expert in Google Analytics 4, ensuring best practices are followed and providing training or guidance to team members as needed.

Requisitos

  • Experience: 2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a fintech, digital product, or SaaS environment.
  • Analytics Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and familiarity with other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
  • Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights and present findings effectively to stakeholders.
  • Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex problems using data.
  • A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product hypotheses and feature performance.
  • Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.

Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Driven | Data Functional Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €652M. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology.

We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 18 EMEA countries. Become one of our +8.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security.

Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Devoteam is looking for a Data Functional Analyst:

Generate and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly operational reports.
Extract and manipulate data from various systems using SQL queries.
Utilize advanced Excel to organize, analyze, and present data clearly and effectively.
Perform data analysis to identify patterns, anomalies, and opportunities for operational improvement.
Support the operations team in developing metrics and KPIs.
Collaborate with different departments to ensure reporting needs are met.
Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data presented in reports.
Provide insights to support data-driven decision-making.


Qualifications

 

Solid experience with SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, advanced formulas, charts).
Experience in data analysis or creating operational reports.
Ability to identify trends and insights from data.
Strong communication skills to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams.
Attention to detail and analytical thinking.

Nice to have:

Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of report automation.
Familiarity with agile methodologies is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team’s responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9


Your Main Activities Are


Perform data collection and build/maintain reliable data pipelines
Work on data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Build and optimize the data processing, being in charge of sourcing and connecting data
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises


Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Information Technology / Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Python
Standard SQL
Tableau
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Ability to develop and adapt a process

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Power BI and Data Trainee
HTML:
Sobre nós:

O GroupM é o líder global de gestão de investimentos em Media, atuando como empresa-mãe das agências de media da WPP: EssenceMediacom, Mindshare e Wavemaker, cada uma com operações globais próprias e posições de liderança no mercado.

O principal objetivo do GroupM é maximizar o desempenho das agências de media, criando e gerindo as estratégias de negócios das agências,desenvolvendo produtos e serviços, negociação, criação de conteúdo, digital, finanças, desenvolvimento de ferramentas proprietárias e outras necessidades críticas dos negócios.

O foco da GroupM é alavancar uma vantagem incomparável no mercado para os seus clientes, stakeholders e pessoas, de forma a que a publicidade funcione melhor para todos.

Sabe mais sobre o GroupM aqui.

Sobre a função:

Como Power BI and Data Treinee, farás parte da nossa equipa de Business Operations e terás oportunidade de aprender e desenvolver competências em Business Intelligence.

É fundamental que sejas orientado para os pormenores e que gostes muito de trabalhar com números.

Responsabilidades:

  • Ajudar na recolha, classificação e manutenção de dados para análise e utilização interna para melhoria e desenvolvimento do negócio;
  • Assistência na elaboração, desenvolvimento e atualização de relatórios e dashboards;
  • Efetuar verificações básicas de dados para garantir a exatidão, a coerência e a qualidade dos dados recolhidos e analisados;
  • Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com a equipa de operações comerciais para compreender as necessidades do negócio e das equipas e contribuir para os projetos.

Experiência:

  • Licenciatura numa área relevante como Data Analytics ou semelhante;
  • Atenção ao detalhe: grande preocupação com a exatidão e meticulosidade no tratamento de dados;
  • Aptidão Numérica: estares confortável em trabalhar com números e conceitos matemáticos básicos;
  • Conhecimentos básicos de informática (familiaridade com Excel ou outro software de folha de cálculo);
  • Interesse em aprender Power BI ou outras ferramentas de visualização de dados;
  • Entusiasmo para a aquisição de novas competências e conhecimentos;
  • Boas capacidades de comunicação verbal e escrita;
  • Fluência em português e inglês.

O que oferecemos:

  • Telemóvel para uso profissional + tarifário;
  • Dias de férias adicionais;
  • Plataformas de wellbeing e apoio ao work-life balance;
  • Acesso aos descontos do Grupo WPP (ginásios, restaurantes, hotéis, etc.);
  • Sistema de trabalho híbrido de acordo com a equipa na qual te inseres;
  • Café, fruta e cereais grátis para um pequeno almoço e lanche saudável.

Title: Junior Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Quality Analyst to oversee and resolve data quality incidents, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our data assets. As the central point for identifying, documenting, and addressing data issues, you will play a critical role in conducting root cause analyses and implementing solutions to mitigate risks and prevent recurring problems and incidents. Your work will directly support the organization’s decision-making processes by maintaining high data standards and fostering trust in our data systems.

In this role, you will use monitoring and incident analysis tools to track data quality issues and analyze patterns. Collaborating closely with technical and business teams, you will document incidents, recommend corrective actions, and ensure timely resolutions. Leveraging your analytical and problem-solving skills, you will drive improvements in data processes and help establish proactive measures to maintain data reliability across the organization.

This position is ideal for an analytical thinker who enjoys solving complex data problems and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive data excellence.

Your profile


Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience at least 2 years of experience in data quality analysis and incident management, with a proven ability to document, investigate, and resolve data issues.
Proficiency in using monitoring and incident analysis tools. Expertise in root cause analysis techniques and the ability to identify patterns and causes of problems as well as address systemic issues.
Proficiency in SQL and hands-on experience with BI tools such as Power BI and Grafana.
Knowledge of data ecosystems and concepts of lineage between tables.
Strong analytical and organizational skills, with excellent communication abilities to effectively coordinate corrective actions between technical and business teams. A proactive mindset and attention to detail are essential for success in this role.
Managing and documenting demands coming from the ticketing tool. Resolving problems such as missing data and procedural inconsistencies.


Nice To Have


Python is desirable, but not mandatory.


What You'll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Title: Global Talent Data Analyst (Temporary-12 months)
Description:
Share this job



The Opportunity: 

As a Global Talent Data Specialist, your mission is to leverage advanced data analytics techniques and tools to extract actionable insights and enhance decision-making throughout our organization. You will collaborate closely with key stakeholders, applying statistical modelling and data visualization skills to ensure data quality and enable informed decisions within the Talent & Rewards (Talent Acquisition, Capacity & Workforce Planning, Talent Management, Learning & Development and Rewards) function.  

How You’ll Make An Impact

Talent & Rewards Data Analytics & Data Quality Focus:


Gather and transform organizational raw data into actionable insights.  
Design and coordinate the deployment of analytical tools, metrics, and reports to inform business decisions.  
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of Talent data and implement Data Governance Practices.  


Functional Expertise


Understand Talent related processes while providing expertise in People Analytics methodologies.  
Act as the Capacity & Workforce Planning subject matter expert (Subject Matter Expert) and Technical Admin for dedicated tools.  


Stakeholder Management


Collaborate with Center of Expertise Functional Leaders and Business Unit single point of contact. 
Pivot the coordination with HR Ops and IT, when applicable. 
Translate data findings into meaningful recommendations. 


Technical Proficiency: You will work with Excel, Power BI, Power Query and SQL. Data manipulation, dashboards and visualizations development and ETLs will be part of your daily basis.

Proactive And Innovative Approach


Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.  
Propose innovative solutions to enhance Talent related processes.


 

Your background: 


Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.  
Proven experience in People Analytics or HR Data Analysis. 
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.  
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities with curiosity and a proactive mindset. 
Excellent Skills in Excel, Power BI, Power Query and MS Office. 
Fluent English. 
Knowledge about SQL, Machine Learning, Talent, Learning and Rewards Functions as well as statistical analysis and predictive modelling is a nice to have.



More About Us

Our employee benefit programs are tailored to each country depending on location of employment and job grade. Please contact your talent acquisition partner for more specific information on the employee benefit program offering in your intended country of employment more information will be available during the recruitment process.

Apply now

Location Remote - Barcelona, Spain;

Remote - Lisbon, Portugal Job type Full time Experience Experienced Job function Human Resources Contract Temporary Publication date 2024-12-23 Reference number R0070212

  • Understand Talent related processes while providing expertise in People Analytics methodologies.  
  • Act as the Capacity & Workforce Planning subject matter expert (Subject Matter Expert) and Technical Admin for dedicated tools.  

Stakeholder Management

  • Collaborate with Center of Expertise Functional Leaders and Business Unit single point of contact. 
  • Pivot the coordination with HR Ops and IT, when applicable. 
  • Translate data findings into meaningful recommendations. 

Technical Proficiency: You will work with Excel, Power BI, Power Query and SQL. Data manipulation, dashboards and visualizations development and ETLs will be part of your daily basis.

Proactive And Innovative Approach

  • Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.  
  • Propose innovative solutions to enhance Talent related processes.

 

Your background: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.  
  • Proven experience in People Analytics or HR Data Analysis. 
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.  
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities with curiosity and a proactive mindset. 
  • Excellent Skills in Excel, Power BI, Power Query and MS Office. 
  • Fluent English. 
  • Knowledge about SQL, Machine Learning, Talent, Learning and Rewards Functions as well as statistical analysis and predictive modelling is a nice to have.


More About Us

Our employee benefit programs are tailored to each country depending on location of employment and job grade. Please contact your talent acquisition partner for more specific information on the employee benefit program offering in your intended country of employment more information will be available during the recruitment process.

Apply now

Location Remote - Barcelona, Spain;

Remote - Lisbon, Portugal Job type Full time Experience Experienced Job function Human Resources Contract Temporary Publication date 2024-12-23 Reference number R0070212

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Risk Management, Trading Risk, Equities, Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities, Data Analytics

About The Job

The Financial Resources Analytics is accountable for delivering excellence in all trading risk strategy activities we lead or oversee. This includes ensuring that these activities align with the Bank's objectives, client goals, approved risk appetites, and strategic priorities.

Your Main Activities Are


Assess and challenge the allocation and management of Risk and Resources (R&R) by the Business Lines (FICC) to ensure a strategic optimization of returns
Analyse Risk measures linked to capital consumption of Bank activities and ensure that return is optimised for capital allocation
Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements, and anticipate/ plan future regulatory changes, in relation to R&R management and capital allocation
Propose and implement solutions to facilitate new trades when BNPP’s risk appetite is reached
Identify and suggest innovative ideas to improve the Bank’s risk processes and reduce inaccuracies
Understand and monitor the main characteristics and concentrations of the risk portfolio managed by the team
Prepare periodic and ad-hoc reports on individual counterparties, sectors and/ or country crisis
Contribute to the reporting of the main risks and stress-tests across Global Markets
Maintain, improve and develop a toolbox for efficient risk management


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Financial Mathematics or Engineering
Interest in Financial Markets
Expertise with data analysis– Python, VBA and SQL (Strongly referred)
Ability to provide clear and concise analysis
Process oriented with a problem-solving mindset
Curiosity, Attention to detail and Autonomy
Ability to communicate clearly – both oral and written forms
Fluency in English
Structured, methodical and organized approach to work


About The Team

The Global Equities and Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities (FICC) Trading Risk Strategy (TRS) Team is responsible for managing trading positions' risk and returns. To achieve this, we oversee the daily production of key position reports and stress tests for trading desks, as well as a weekly in-depth review of positions and Profit/ Loss (P&L) performance. Additionally, we participate in ad-hoc studies and deep dives to assess specific portfolio risks and expected returns, upon request.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer Internship
Description:
Keywords: Data Analytics, ETL, Oriented programming, SQL, Tableau, git, python

Your Main Activities Are


Development, maintenance, and support of data processing and analytical stacks
Ensure architecture meets business requirements
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data
Develop data ETL processes in production environment
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations
Proof of concept data projects with innovative methods or tools


Profile And Skills To Success


Master in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electronic, Biomedical or similar Engineering Master
Knowledge with Python programming language (Java/C++/C# will be considered)
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
Knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of Tableau
Knowledge and interest in financial markets
Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written
Effective problem solver and consensus builder
Team work and collaborative mind-set
Fluency in English


About The Team

The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity. The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner. The team in Lisbon is comprised of 9 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management. We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Why joining BNP Paribas?

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Número da Solicitação de Emprego: 87464

Horário: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Become part of The Centre of Insights and Analytics (CIA) team that is working with all DSV business divisions as well as Group Functions to simplify information gathering and turning data into insight
Create visually powerful dashboards in Microsoft Power BI that turn data into information
Champion user experience best practices for business stakeholders
Be a business partner for both business divisions/Group Functions as well as IT departments, acting as an interface to bring business intelligence to the next level
Support BI management in the implementation of the Global BI Roadmap
Design, develop, document and maintain business intelligence solutions
Support the advanced analytics team in creating advanced analytics solutions
Work in projects together with the business partners internally
Act as knowledge hub for Microsoft Power BI to empower business partners



Our requirements:



University degree in IT, business studies or any related studies
Minimum 2 years of experience in similar position (Business Intelligence)
Proven expert knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (focus on Microsoft Power BI)
Ability to visualize information in a value adding way
Experience with complex DAX functions and Power Query
Deep knowledge of BI processes and good practices characteristic for a large corporation
Practical SQL scripting knowledge (ideally SQL Server with optimization knowledge)
Azure Data Stack knowledge (Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services, Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2), with special focus on Databricks
Knowledge of advanced analytics / data science methodologies and tools (R, python, Pytorch)
Knowledge of data modelling concepts
Basic knowledge of SAP Business Warehouse
Basic knowledge of financial data structures
Fluent English both spoken and written



Our offer:



Permanent contract
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Client Development Data Analyst
Description:
Your Main Activities Are


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Experience with SQL
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analyse, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge in Tableau, Power BI, Power Query and DAX is a plus


About The Team

The Client Development team supports Global & Regional Sales, and Trading and M360 Heads in driving steady increases of wallet shares and client profitability with target clients, through client forums, client prioritization, client planning and survey intelligence.

The Client Development Team Ensures


Analysis of internal and external data to identify business growth opportunities
Ensure we are delivering on our KPIs to support the client strategy and roadmap
Support to team specialists in London, New York and Hong Kong to be more rigorous on the sales process globally, providing all the necessary information and tools to drive accurate business decisions
Promotion and contribution to report automation for a greater level of client intelligence and information-sharing
Data accuracy and integrity across multiple data streams and dashboards


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders’ needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
  • You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
  • Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
  • Fluency in written and spoken English
  • Ability to analyse, synthetize and simplify.
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
  • Knowledge in Tableau, Power BI, Power Query and DAX is a plus

About The Team

The Client Development team supports Global & Regional Sales, and Trading and M360 Heads in driving steady increases of wallet shares and client profitability with target clients, through client forums, client prioritization, client planning and survey intelligence.

The Client Development Team Ensures

  • Analysis of internal and external data to identify business growth opportunities
  • Ensure we are delivering on our KPIs to support the client strategy and roadmap
  • Support to team specialists in London, New York and Hong Kong to be more rigorous on the sales process globally, providing all the necessary information and tools to drive accurate business decisions
  • Promotion and contribution to report automation for a greater level of client intelligence and information-sharing
  • Data accuracy and integrity across multiple data streams and dashboards

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Production Support Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • At least 3 years experience in a similar role;
  • 2 years' experience in the field of insurance policies and claims;
  • Advanced SQL skills;
  • Strong knowledge of data storage concepts and structures, ETL and BI architecture;
  • Proven experience in RDBMS platforms for creating DDL;
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
MAIN PURPOSE

The Data Engineer will integrate in the Group Technology Data team. He/She will be responsible for the acquisition and modeling of data to provide outputs for analytics and data science.

The Data Engineer will focus on building consumable models and data visualizations, but will ultimately be responsible for the full data life cycle within the assigned task/project/product area, from data ingestion to data processing and preparation.

He/She will work closely with the Group Data Office to ensure the end-to-end consistency of the related data products.

Key Responsibilities


Translate the business requirements into technical specifications, in cooperation with Group Data Office.
Estimate, plan, manage, and lead the assigned data integration projects/tasks within the Data Warehouse team. Coordinate the related tasks and workload with the rest of the Data Warehouse engineers.
Build corresponding ETL/ELT processes and data flows to provide data outputs for analytics and data science.
Create consumable data models and visualizations.
Cooperate with the support teams to ensure data consistency, data accuracy, and performance of the delivered flows. Provide L3 support when required.
Define and promote best practices and design principles for Data Warehouse and Analytics architecture in cooperation with the Data Warehouse architect.


Key Qualifications


University degree in computer science, engineering, or comparable field.
At least four years working in comparable engineering roles.
Strong programing skills in SQL, and Python.
Strong knowledge of Looker (including LookML).
Experience with dbt.
Knowledge of dbt and version management tools (e.g. GIT).
Experience with cloud data warehouses, preferable with GCP – BigQuery.
Scrum methodology knowledge.


HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a great opportunity to truly gain great insight into the luxury markets and work with the latest innovations to create value from corporate data. You will be a part of a dynamic and international work environment, where we always go the extra mile to uphold outstanding service for our clients. We will provide you great learning opportunities and exposure into modern technologies on Google stack.


Show more
