Title: Data Engineer
Description:
You’ll be focused in


Creating and maintaining data pipeline architecture
Assembling large, complex data sets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements
Building the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technologies
Building analytics tools that use the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics
Managing the data architecture for data ingestion, pipeline setup and data curation
Manipulating data at scale, getting data in a ready-to-use state in close alignment with various business and Spoke stakeholders.



In order to succeed, you’ll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Strong experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets
Experience building processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management
Experience automating processes with Python scripting language
Strong knowledge of AWS IaC and IaaS services
Strong communication and analytical skills
Great English skills, both written and spoken.



Nice to have


Experience with big data tools and distributed clusters such as Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Kinesis;
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Glue Workflow.



About The Product

The Data & Analytics Hub focuses on data processes, bringing insights to the business and contributing to improve MAN Truck & Bus products efficiency in areas related to vehicle engineering & production and sales & after sales.

Company Benefits


1200€ to equip your home office
720€ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗

Title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world’s largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We’re a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages – and we’re continuing to grow rapidly!

We believe we can make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better. Buying better isn't just about saving money; it's also helping businesses to make the world around them better by buying products and services that that are from green, ethical, sustainable, diverse and inclusive suppliers. At Efficio, we do that by being the world's largest procurement and supply chain consultancy firm. We also do that by combining our procurement expertise with our powerful technology and data to help our customers make better purchasing decisions. Data is a fundamental ingredient to that decision making process and we're now investing heavily in building our in-house data skills, expertise and infrastructure to rival the best in the world. So, if you'd like to make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better, apply here. Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape.

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
🌟 Opportunity : Data Engineer

Our client is a leading player in the e-commerce/marketplace sector, operating a trusted and innovative online marketplace that connects millions of users daily. Committed to sustainability and promoting the circular economy, they simplify transactions and create value for individuals and businesses alike

🚀 Responsibilities :


Develop and maintain robust, reliable applications for optimal data flow, including APIs, streaming applications, and the industrialization of machine learning models.
Optimize cloud architecture and infrastructure, focusing on storage, security, and automation within an AWS environment.
Support internal teams in effectively utilizing the data platform, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Proactively contribute to technological research, innovation, and knowledge-sharing within the team.
Ensure system availability, performance, and evolution while maintaining strict compliance with GDPR and other data protection regulations.
Collaborate with technical product teams and manage integration with external components.


👤 Profile sought :

Education :


A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.


Experience :


A minimum of 2 years of professional experience in data engineering or a similar role.


Technical Skills :


Advanced knowledge of Java and Python in Unix-based environments.
Proficiency with distributed systems architecture and cloud platforms, particularly AWS (S3, Redshift, Athena, Glue, DynamoDB).
Experience with tools such as Airflow, Spark, Elasticsearch, Kafka, Kubernetes, and Docker.
Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, Ansible, and Helm.
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data pipelines.


Soft Skills:


Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in team settings.
Excellent attention to detail, results-oriented, and a continuous learner.
High level of curiosity and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal, is required.


🌍 Benefits & Culture :


A forward-thinking, innovative work environment focusing on teamwork and inclusion.
Opportunities for professional development and career progression.
Commitment to work-life balance and employee well-being.
Be part of a mission-driven company contributing to sustainable development.


💼 Department : Tech

📍 Location : Full-remote project, Portugal based

📆 Starting date : ASAP

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
HTML:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

A Babel é uma empresa multinacional que fornece serviços tecnológicos orientados para apoiar grandes empresas dos setores da Administração Pública, Banca, Seguros, Indústria e Telecomunicações no seu processo de Transformação Digital.

Estamos em Portugal, Espanha, Marrocos, Colômbia, Costa Rica, República Dominicana, Estados Unidos, Chile, México e Panamá. Uma parte essencial da missão da Babel é oferecer aos colaboradores uma carreira profissional de longa duração, pois acreditamos no trabalho em equipa, nas pessoas e na sua força quando elas combinam a sua paixão com o seu talento.

Nosso plano estratégico

Olhamos para o futuro! O novo plano estratégico Hyperspace 2029 promete ser uma viagem emocionante, cheia de oportunidades para crescer e desenvolver-se profissionalmente. Chegar aos 1000 milhões de faturação, um desafio que estamos confiantes que, com a colaboração e o talento dos nossos colaboradores, será mais uma história de sucesso que escreveremos juntos.

Local de Trabalho:

Formato de trabalho:

Hybrid

Função:

Data Analytics Engineer

O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, ou similar;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 2 anos na área de Data (Analytics & Engineering);
  • Experiência em arquiteturas de gestão de dados baseadas na Cloud, particularmente em ambientes Azure;
  • Capacidade na conceção e construção de pipelines de dados de alto desempenho e na modelação de dados;
  • Certificações relevantes em Dados e Análises (plus);
  • Domínio do inglês.

#babel

O que oferecemos:

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.

Queres fazer parte de uma equipa em crescimento, empenhada e inovadora que faz história todos os dias? Na Babel, acompanhamos-te no caminho para o sucesso. Acreditamos no talento das pessoas e queremos promovê-lo, oferecendo-te um excelente ambiente de trabalho baseado na colaboração e na solidariedade.

Trabalhar na Babel é muito mais do que trabalhar numa empresa, é juntar-se a uma equipa de pessoas com uma missão partilhada e um modelo de empresa centrado em valores.

Além disso:

  • Carreira profissional e formação contínua;
  • Contrato indeterminado;
  • Remuneração atrativa;
  • Pacote de vantagens sociais à escolha;
  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Sistema de férias inovador;
  • Participação nos lucros da empresa.

Junta-te a nós!

Descobre todas as vantagens de trabalhar na nossa equipa!

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt/personas/valores-de-babel

Em cumprimento com a legislação vigente em matéria de proteção de dados, informamos que o GRUPO BABEL é responsável pelos seus dados pessoais e que os utilizará para levar a cabo processos de recrutamento interno, com base no seu consentimento, mediante o fornecimento dos seus dados curriculares e na aplicação de medidas pré-contratuais. Os dados poderão ser comunicados às entidades que integram o GRUPO BABEL com o objetivo de lhe oferecer o emprego adequado ao seu perfil profissional e aos estabelecidos por lei. Poderá aceder, retificar e eliminar os dados, bem como outros direitos que lhe assistem em matéria de proteção de dados através do site data.protection@babelgroup.com. Mais informações sobre a proteção de dados podem ser consultadas na nossa política de privacidade.

Title: Data Engineer (Lisbon)
HTML:
About Our Company

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

Your role

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team.

Your profile

  • Experience in ADF with Big Data context;
  • Autonomy in Pyspark;
  • Hands-on in language - practical exercices;
  • Knowlodge of parque/avro files, delta tables and execution and optimization;

Nice To Have

  • Unity Catalog and Purview;
  • Informatica Power Center;
  • Power BI.
  • Experience with PySpark for task automation and optimisation in Databricks.

What You'll Love About Working Here

  • Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment;
  • Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance;
  • Engage in exciting national and international projects;
  • Hybrid work;
  • Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities;
  • Training and certifications programs;
  • Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
  • Great office locations.

Why Capgemini?

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. It is also part of our culture to care about the environment and to carry out actions of social and environmental corporate responsibility.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Engineer for an national project in the banks sector.

💡 What We Are Looking For


Python
PySpark
PowerBI
SQL
English - Expert


⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Reconciliation of professional and family life

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians customers, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject DE.RM.DB

Learn more about Axians

Title: Data Analyst (Lead) ID27457
HTML:
AgileEngine is one of the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies in the U and a top-3 ranked dev shop according to Clutch. We create award-winning custom software solutions that help companies across 15+ industries change the lives of millions

If you like a challenging environment where you’re working with the best and are encouraged to learn and experiment every day, there’s no better place - guaranteed! :)

What you will do

  • Design A/B experiments to evaluate the impact of changes we make to the product using statistical methodologies;
  • Use expert level SQL & Python & R programming to develop data pipelines, write complex queries, and perform deep dive data analysis;
  • Break down nuanced, complex data for partners, keeping context at the forefront of communication;
  • Develop and automate reports in Tableau, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations;
  • Define and monitor key KPI’s; investigate changes in metrics and propose next steps;
  • Contribute to our team and company data culture through accessible database design and maintenance.

Must haves

  • Minimum of 3-5 years experience in the following:
  • SQL;
  • Python;
  • BI tools (Tableau);
  • Analytics tools (Google Analytics & Mixpanel);
  • Snowflake;
  • DBT;
  • Deep understanding of relational databases and data warehousing;
  • Working knowledge of Airflow, Nomad and other deployment tools;
  • Git PR workflows;
  • Lean heavier on Data science skills – preferable to have mix of SQL/Data science rather than just SQL;
  • Working knowledge of various machine learning techniques and 1-2 years experience in building and deploying ML/AI solutions;
  • Upper-intermediate English level.

Nice to haves

  • Knowing R programming is a bonus;
  • Startup & PropTech/Real Estate industry experienced preferred but not required.

The benefits of joining us

  • Professional growth

Accelerate your professional journey with mentorship, TechTalks, and personalized growth roadmaps.

  • Competitive compensation

We match your ever-growing skills, talent, and contributions with competitive USD-based compensation and budgets for education, fitness, and team activities.

  • A selection of exciting projects

Join projects with modern solutions development and top-tier clients that include Fortune 500 enterprises and leading product brands.

  • Flextime

Tailor your schedule for an optimal work-life balance, by having the options of working from home and going to the office – whatever makes you the happiest and most productive.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
“Be part of our exciting data journey, providing the edge of the technology for analytics and reporting to a worldwide user community. Supporting all our Maisons in their captivating luxury business.”

CONTEXT

You will be part of the Analytics Platforms team within the central Group Technology Data Platforms organization.

Help providing self-service capabilities for business departments to work autonomously and transforming data into intuitive and meaningful analytical solutions that enable actionable insights and informed business decisions.

Manage central systems, process support requests, and ensure self-service analytics environment is up-to-date and compliant that enables business users to successfully deliver analytical projects.

Ensure implementation of the Group Technology strategy provided by the Data Office management team.

Ensure implementation and maintenance of the global template (Hub&Spoke) in terms of systems, governance, processes & functions on a worldwide scale.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As part of the Analytics Platforms team, you will be a trusted partner for our business to help roll-out our self-service analytics platform Google Looker.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Be


Work closely with Google Looker platform owner to monitor and keep the Google Looker Platform up-to-date.
Monitor and query system activity data using API
Provide daily operational support to business users on LookML, dbt according to the best practices and enable them to continually improve their projects autonomously.
Optimize performance of LookML and dashboards
Setup new projects in Looker and help leveraging Hub&Spoke architecture.
Promote Looker good practices and security culture.
Liaise with software providers on support and innovation topics.
Provide a clear documentation related to the areas under responsibility.
Use Jira to manage backlog and priorities.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCESS WITH US?

You have a university degree in Business Informatics/Information Systems/Management Information Systems and the following experience:


mandatory professional experience with Google Looker as LookML developer (at least 1-year working experience)
experience with Python, gitlab, dbt and complex queries developments in BigQuery
experience with Looker API is a big plus
experience with performance tuning (knowledge of monitoring tools & technical solutions to get the best performance)
experience in business consulting and international exposure
experience with user support is a plus


You have following qualities and aptitude: proactive interest in technology and innovations, analytical and problem-solving skills, multitasking, client-oriented and team mindset.

Languages: fluent in English, French is nice to have.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a great opportunity to truly gain great insight into the luxury markets and work with the latest innovations to create value from corporate data. You will be a part of a dynamic and international work environment, where we always go the extra mile to uphold outstanding service for our clients. We will provide you great learning opportunities and exposure into modern technologies on Google stack.

Title: Analista Sénior de Qualidade de Dados
HTML:
Country: Portugal

Principais características da função:

  • Análise e compreensão do funcionamento das Áreas do Banco relevantes e dos principais repositórios e motores de dados utilizados, nomeadamente em Capital, ALM, Mercados Financeiros, Controlo de Gestão (MIS), Contabilidade, Riscos, Analítica de Dados.
  • Identificação e inventariação de incidências de qualidade de dados, nomeadamente a partir da exploração programática de repositórios de dados do banco, de relatórios de Auditoria ou dos Supervisores, ou de análises pelas distintas Áreas;
  • Avaliação dos temas identificados, identificação de casuísticas e priorização;
  • Colaboração na definição de estratégias ou planos de atuação para correção de incidências;
  • Análise end-to-end, reformulação e otimização do desenho de processos e/ou workflows e apoio na implementação das alterações com o objetivo de assegurar qualidade e coerência integral – para o efeito, articulação com Áreas relevantes e/ou Tecnologia;
  • Análises de consistência entre distintos processos do Banco repositórios;
  • Análise e preparação de reportes periódicos e informação de Gestão.

Formação e conhecimentos:

  • Mestrado em Gestão, Finanças, Economia, Engenharia Informática, Matemática, Engenharia e Gestão Industrial ou equivalente;
  • Conhecimentos de exploração de dados e gestão de dados (SQL, SAS, R, Python) são desejáveis;
  • Conhecimentos de Inglês;
  • Experiência mínima de 4 anos em funções similares.

Perfil:

  • Capacidade de análise, com espírito crítico e construtivo;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade e orientação para o detalhe e rigor;
  • Boas capacidades de organização, autonomia e proatividade;
  • Dedicação e resiliência;
  • Espírito de equipa e boa comunicação interpessoal.

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: T-SQL developer
Description:
Company Description

Alter Solutions Portugal is an IT Consultancy Company, promoter of Digital Transformation, part of the Alter Solutions Group, created in 2006, in Paris.

In 2022, Alter Solutions joined the act digital group, constituting a global community of talent in Technology, with presence in thirteen countries: Germany, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, United States of America, Mexico, Morocco, Spain, France, Luxembourg, Poland, Portugal and Serbia. Also in 2023, we were certified as a Great Place to Work©.

In Portugal, we partner with over 120 clients and a team of over 500 people, working in projects for industries as diverse as banking, insurance, transportation, aviation, energy, and telecom.

Headquarters of the Nearshore IT center, Alter Solutions Portugal has a dedicated team of around 30 specialized professionals, integrated into projects with several internationally renowned clients.

Job Description

Job Description:

We’re seeking a highly skilled T-SQL developer to join our team. As a T-SQL developer, the candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining T-SQL code and ensuring its stability, reliability, and performance. The candidate will work with our development, business analysts, and operational teams and contribute to various projects, including database optimization, data integration, reporting, and data-driven application development.

Main Responsibilities


Design and optimize complex SQL queries for high-performance data retrieval and manipulation.
Optimizing database performance and ensuring data integrity.
Troubleshooting and resolving database-related issues.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and implement solutions.
Creating and maintaining database documentation.
Provide estimates for work / updates of status and estimates to complete.
Support user tests.
Provide 3rd level support.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Bachelor's degree in computer science or engineering 
Strong proficiency in T-SQL and database concepts        
Minimum 5 years’ experience with database development tool MS SQL Server and associated technologies        
Familiarity with performance tuning and query optimization        
Knowledge of data modeling and database design principles.  
Experience with IBM WebSphere Transformation Extender [nice to have]
Proficiency in English (spoken and written) is mandatory.


Soft Skills


Rigorous, autonomous, team-oriented, result-oriented and proactive.    
Experience with Agile methodologies and tools such as Jira.
At ease with financial concepts and/or interested to learn the Business & Bank organization.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, both independently and as part of a team.  
Attention to detail and strong analytical thinking.

Title: Wealth Management Data Analyst for Performance Management Sites Team
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses which will support BNP Paribas Internal clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Run the PowerBI platform [data visualization tool]
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor degree in Finance, Business Administration or Information Technology
At least 2 years of Experience as Data Analyst
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Pack (MS Excel)
Proficiency in PowerBI
Knowledge of Information Technology
Fluent in English
Strong analysis capacity, Rigor and accuracy, dynamism, autonomy, organization, and responsibility
Strong interpersonal working relationships and team spirit


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Description:
At IRIUM we want you to always chase your dreams. Here, prepare yourself to conquer your goals, while enjoying the journey. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About The Job


BNPP Global Markets Americas is looking to expand its team of dedicated data engineers in Portugal to support Prime Services, part of the Global Equities Global Business Line (GBL).
The team in Portugal works closely with Prime Services Prime Trading Americas. This team is focused on generating business analytics, building data pipelines, and projects implementation to better position the business for their current and future needs. A primary focus of the role is assisting in the improvement of funding efficiencies and meeting client demand through improved data availability and analysis, client insights, and ultimately through enhanced data and business processes. The ability to work with large amount of messy data and designing and then implementing improved data models will be important. A successful candidate should have strong communication skills, be a team player, have the ability to learn quickly, and focus on delivery in a fast-paced environment. The job will require interaction with Front Office, Technology, and Product Development.


Your Main Activities Are


The required position would support Equity Financing business in its reporting : creation / automation / monitoring (both the indicators produced and the fact that report is being produced)
Within the Support team, the individual will work closely with Front Office and Quant Research :
Monitor production of daily reports required by the business :
Trouble shot with IT in case of production issue
Data quality check day over day. Escalation to Operations (MO) and Front in case of booking issue
Improve automation of reports production
Work with Business and Quant to enhance existing reports with new data / method
Automate production from XL based template to server based production
Design new reports, and provide analysis and optimization suggestion
Work with business to enhance our reporting framework to display more relevant indicators
Once familiar with data, help in the analysis of the reports , highlight outsiders and suggest improvements
Ability to travel to New York for a period of up to 1 month for on-desk experience and training

Profile and Skills to Success


BA, BS or MS degree in a quantitative discipline (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Finance or Economics)
1-4 years of relevant experience such as in Data Analytics or Engineering
Experience in Capital Markets or Investment Banking
Perfect fluency in English
Good communication skills
Proficiency in Python, SQL Excel and VBA
Quantitative, analytical and logical problem solving skill
Basic knowledge of financial markets and Prime Brokerage
Experience using Dev-ops tools such as GIT, Jira and APIs


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities

Data Integration and Transformation:


Design, develop, and maintain ETL pipelines to integrate data from various sources into the Domo platform.
Use tools and scripts (e.g., SQL, Python) to clean, transform, and optimize data for reporting and analytics.


Domo Platform Management


Configure and manage datasets, dataflows, and dashboards within Domo.
Develop advanced Domo cards and visualizations to support business needs.
Monitor the performance and reliability of Domo workflows, troubleshooting and optimizing as necessary.


Collaboration With Stakeholders


Work closely with business teams to understand data requirements and deliver tailored solutions.
Translate complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical users.


Data Governance And Quality


Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all datasets and reports. Implement best practices for data security, privacy, and compliance in line with organizational standards.


Performance Monitoring And Optimization


Continuously monitor data pipeline performance and identify opportunities for optimization.
Address bottlenecks and scaling issues as data volumes and business demands grow.


Essential Skills


Minimum 2 years' experience in a similar role;
Hands-on experience with Domo, including data ingestion, data flows, Magic ETL and card development;
Experience in ETL, SQL and Python;
Understanding of data warehouse concepts and experience with systems such as Snowflake, Redshift or BigQuery;
Fluent English.

Title: Data Engineer - DataBricks
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer - DataBricks

Location: Lisboa

Work Regime: Hybrid

Step into a dynamic ecosystem where the future of business is created and lived every day. Be part of it!

At LUZA Group, passion, perseverance, and the drive to excel define our path to success.

Founded in 2006, we are a Portuguese multinational with over 1,200 talented professionals and a turnover surpassing €30M. With a strong presence in key markets—Portugal, Spain, Morocco, Brazil, Mexico, the United States, and China—we deliver innovative solutions in engineering, IT, design, consulting, Industry 4.0, training, and recruitment. Our people and their talent power everything we do.

This is a moment of growth and opportunity. The future belongs to visionary minds. Will you join us?

About The Position

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for understanding business and technological challenges, develop data pipelines tackling those challenges, and ensuring their smooth deployment.

You will as well be responsible of the applications of standard industry and within-the-company good practices, and the application and evolution of our various patterns.

Responsibilities

Projects understanding and Communication


Understand problems from a user perspective and communicate to clearly understand the issue.
Ensure the architecture provided by the Data Architect is clearly understood by yourself.
Communicate with the Data Architect and your peers on the technical solution youre developing and communicate with the Project Manager in charge of the project youre working on.



Development


Write and communicate on new or updated interface contracts.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data lakes, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling.
Develop data pipelines based on the defined architecture.
Ensure the regular good practices are applied.
Deploy requested infrastructure, particularly using Terraform.
Make peer reviews and ask to your peers to review your code when merging a new version of the codebase.



Testing


Define tests with your project manager, based on the functional and technical requirements of the pipeline youre developing.
Perform those tests and communicate regularly on the results.
Regularly summarize the results of your tests in a dedicated document.



Deployments


Present to the Data Architect in charge of the architecture, and the Lead DataOps, the development that was performed through our Deployment Reviews.
Track and communicate on any potential errors in the entire period of active monitoring following a deployment.
Ensure diligent application of deployment process, logging, and monitoring strategy.



Requirements


Proficiency with PySpark and Spark SQL for data processing.
Experience with Databricks using Unit Catalog.
Knowledge of Delta Live Tables (DLT) for automated ETL and workflow orchestration in Databricks.
Familiarity with Azure Data Lake Storage.
Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow or similar) for building and scheduling ETL/ELT pipelines.
Knowledge of data partitioning and data lifecycle management on cloudbased storage.
Familiarity with implementing data security and data privacy practices in a cloud environment.
Terraform: At least one year of experience with Terraform and know good practices of GitOps.
Additional Knowledge and Experience that are a Plus:
Databricks Asset Bundles
Kubernetes
Apache Kafka
Vault



Personal Traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and stakeholders
Proactive Ownership for the projects delivered by your team
A continuous eye for improvement on existing processes
Clear communication and collaboration skills
Excellent analytical / problem- solving ability
Demonstrated ability to manage your stress in an operational environment
Demonstrated ability to understand quickly business and technical requirements of a data pipeline that needs to be developed, and challenge potential misconceptions
The candidate should have worked in a Data Platform that was in an industrial scale



#VisionaryFuture - Build the future, join our living ecosystem!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (DWH Team)
HTML:
Department: Data Platform

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale’s, use Tabby’s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are hiring a Data Engineer to join our DWH Team, who will help us create our corporate DWH using cloud technologies and best practices for data processing and storage.

Key Responsibilities

  • DWH development for Business Users, Analysts and ML Engineers;
  • Data synchronization between internal and external systems;
  • Development tools for collecting data into DWH;
  • Development EL / ELT / ETL pipelines;
  • Integration new tools and practices for data governance and data quality;
  • Costs optimization.


Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • DWH development and maintenance experience;
  • Architecture: Kimball, Inmon, Medallion;
  • Data modeling: SCD forms, Normal forms, Star Schema, Data Vault;
  • Good knowledges of Python + best practice for Python;
  • Good knowledges of SQL + best practice for SQL;
  • Good knowledge of system design best practices;
  • Familiar with tech stack as Airflow, dbt, BigQuery, Clickhouse, PostgreSQL, Docker, GitLab(CI/CD), GCP;
  • Best practice for data processing and data storing.
  • REST API / GRPC API / Message brokers & Queues;
  • Experience on modern systems of data storing: Relational, MPP, NoSQL;
  • Experience on Google Cloud Platform.


Benefits

  • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
  • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
  • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
  • Participation in company’s employee stock options program.
  • Health Insurance


We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Junior Data Scientist/Engineer
HTML:
Acceleration is WPP’s data and technology consultancy, operated globally by leading media company GroupM. We work closely with GroupM agencies (EssenceMediacom, Mindhsare and Wavemaker) and Google center of excellence to connect our clients' media investments to tangible business results, powering possibilities and performance through data and technology.We make data and technology work better for people and business!Click to discover more about Acceleration and GroupM. We are seeking a highly motivated and adaptable Junior Data Scientist/Engineer to join our small, dynamic team in Lisbon, Portugal.  This entry-level role offers a unique opportunity to gain broad experience across various data-focused disciplines, including machine learning, data engineering, and business intelligence. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in programming, a passion for data analysis, and a willingness to learn and contribute across different areas. This position provides excellent growth potential within a supportive team environment. Responsibilities:
  • Machine Learning: Develop, implement, and deploy machine learning models. Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering. Train and evaluate models;
  • Data Engineering: Support the building and maintenance of data pipelines. Assist in data processing and transformation. Work with databases under the guidance of senior team members;
  • Business Intelligence: Contribute to the development of reports and dashboards. Assist in data analysis and identification of trends;
  • Collaborate with other team members on projects across these disciplines;
  • Actively learn and develop skills in ML/AI, data engineering, and BI;
  • Contribute to the overall improvement of our data capabilities.
 Required Skills and Experience:
  • 1+ year of experience in a data-related role or demonstrable project experience (including internships or academic projects);
  • Strong programming skills in Python;
  • Experience with data warehousing concepts;
  • Experience with data visualization tools;
  • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Basic understanding of data visualization principles;
  • Basic understanding of SQL and relational databases;
  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms;
  • Familiarity with data manipulation and cleaning techniques;
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Good communication and teamwork skills. A strong desire to learn and adapt is essential.
  • Fluent Portuguese language skills.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
About The Job


As Business Analyst of the Business Revenue IT Tribe, your mission will be to provide detailed analysis of the business requirements, closely working with the development team, the users and the other Business Analysts in order to come up with the most efficient solutions.
You will partner with different stakeholders (IT, Operations, Business) in a collaborative way to ensure the proper understanding of the requirement and the correct handover to the development team
You’ll find yourself in an agile and collaborative environment where you’ll have the chance of working with different stakeholders across different business lines, contributing not only on evolutive enhancements but also on transversal and reglementary projects


Your Main Activities Are


Analyzing the high level requirements into more detailed User Stories, assessing impacts, value, and keeping in mind the efficiency and scalability of the solutions
Write test plans (both manual and automated) and support users in the test execution
You will ensure the quality of the new features and follow-up of defects correction
Contribute to the refinement of the requirements ensuring their transparency and clarity, and making them clear to the development team
Produce clear support documentation that will be part of the application
Be an active part on Continuous Improvement of the team
Prepare meetings where you’ll present the status of the projects you are working on to both to the team and to the users
Contribute to the 3rd level of Production support, working with the support team and the application users
Develop meaningful relationships with partners to reach optimized solutions, and respond to queries or concerns from the Product Owner and managers


Profile and Skills to Success


Relevant experience in business analysis
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Business Revenue
Business / IT relationship
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to share / pass on knowledge and learn from others
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability and critical thinking
Communication skills, both written and oral, and capacity to adapt to different audiences
Client focused and pride on delivering solutions with quality
Personal impact / ability to influence


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Ability to collaborate / teamwork
  • Ability to share / pass on knowledge and learn from others
  • Ability to synthetise / simplify
  • Analytical ability and critical thinking
  • Communication skills, both written and oral, and capacity to adapt to different audiences
  • Client focused and pride on delivering solutions with quality
  • Personal impact / ability to influence

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Junior Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
What is Amplemarket all about?

Amplemarket's premise is that a lot of the playbooks used by B2B sales teams that worked 5 years ago don't cut it anymore.

In today's environment, sales teams need to have a tremendous amount of information about their prospects to decide when is the best moment and channel to reach out in the most relevant way. You can't do this with 5 different data/sales enablement point solutions that don't share the same data schema and barely communicate with each other. Amplemarket is the all-in-one compound solution that enables this.

Our AI-powered sales platform helps B2B companies generate more opportunities thanks to our advanced lead generation engine, hyper-personalized sequencing, omnichannel outreach, and AI-powered smart actions. We are backed by Y Combinator, and we are powering the sales teams at some of the fastest-growing companies in the world like Deel, Moveworks, H1 and Vanta.

Important Notice: Beware of Recruitment Scams

It has come to our attention that there are fraudulent activities targeting job seekers, where individuals are impersonating Amplemarket by using fake profiles, domains, and emails.

Please be informed that Amplemarket always uses our main domain (amplemarket.com) for all hiring and recruitment purposes. Any communication or offer not originating from an amplemarket.com email address should be regarded as suspicious.


We will never request personal financial information (such as bank account details) during the initial application or interview process.
Our hiring process does not involve transferring money or making payments of any kind to secure a position.


Amplemarket is not responsible for any loss or damage incurred as a result of job scams or fraudulent activity by third parties misusing our company name.

If you have any doubts about the legitimacy of a job opportunity with Amplemarket, please contact our HR department directly.

We advise you to verify the authenticity of any job-related communications claiming to be from Amplemarket. If you have any concerns or doubts, please contact us directly through our official channels.

Your security is our priority. Thank you for your vigilance and understanding.

Our customers use Amplemarket on a daily basis. We are one of the main tools for their sales reps. When we are down, it means sales reps at hundreds of companies can't do their job. Luckily, you are reading this, and when you join Amplemarket we will reach ∞ 9s availability ;)

As an early member of the infrastructure & automation team, you will build and automate foundational systems for reliability, security, performance, developer velocity, and scale. You will work cross-functionally, supporting the engineering, product, design, customer success, support, and sales functions.

You will:


Scale Amplemarket's core cloud platform for high availability and performance
Detect our blindspots and add observability to mitigate them
Work closely with product engineers to design reliable rollouts of new features
Review code, proposals and participate in architectural discussions
Build reproducible automations for the most urgent infrastructure needs
Define solutions to save our internal teams time when moving code to production
Keep on top of potential threats/patches with a security-first mindset
Participate in the continuous improvement of the development process/workflow


About you:


You have 1-3 years of experience designing and maintaining complex/large/growing systems
You have experience with tools like Kubernetes/Pulumi/Terraform
When reviewing new system designs or code, you naturally think about what can go wrong: edge cases, failure modes, bottlenecks, migrations, releases, interesting metrics, etc
You love debugging and finding the root cause of production issues
You are proactive, when you see something broken you jump on it to fix it or suggest improvements
You can't sleep if something doesn't have enough metrics to ensure everything is working properly


Some more about Amplemarket:


We are a post-Series A start-up
Backed by YCombinator
Strong technical founding team from MIT and IST (also founders of https://fermatslibrary.com/)
Fast growing startup with product market fit
Great team spirit


We offer:


Nice work environment
Competitive Salary
Health Insurance
Stock Options
Annual Company Trip in a secret location
and more


Amplemarket is committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all.

Regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, or if you're parenting the next generation of innovators, we firmly believe that what truly matters is how your skills, knowledge and personality fit our company. So bring your best professional version of yourself, and apply - we'd like to hear from you!

Title: 21 - Developer PL/SQL
HTML:
Procuras uma empresa que seja especializada nas áreas de Project Management, Business Analysis e Agile Transformation?

A PPM Coachers apresenta uma oferta de serviços completa e integrada, tanto nas componentes tradicionais como nas abordagens Agile e que vai desde a Consultoria Estratégica com o desenho de modelos de Demand Management Office (DMO), Project Management Office (PMO) e Service Managament Office (SMO), até a Implementação e Operacionalização de processos, técnicas e ferramentas, passando pelo Reforço da Capacidade (outsourcing) e Desenvolvimento de Competências como uma ferramenta indispensável para suportar a transformação organizacional inerente aos processos de evolução.

Porquê a PPM Coachers?

  • Terás oportunidade de participar em projetos chave com os maiores players nacionais e internacionais do mercado, onde colocarás em prática todo o teu conhecimento dentro das áreas de Project Management, Business Analysis e Agile Transformation.
  • Dispomos de uma equipa experiente, sólida e dinâmica que te irá acompanhar de forma personalizada nesta tua jornada e te ajudará a desenvolver competências nas áreas em que somos especialistas.

A PPM Coachers está a recrutar para a função de Developer PL/SQL!

A Tua Missão

  • Analisar requisitos de negócio e traduzir em soluções técnicas;
  • Manter bases de dados, realizar atualizações e correções;
  • Implementar e monitorizar scripts de automação para processos de ETL;
  • Fornecer suporte técnico e resolver problemas de desempenho de consultas;
  • Participar na revisões de código e garantir práticas recomendadas;
  • Verificar a importação diária de dados e aplicar correções;
  • Verificar que os algoritmos de repartição diários correram como esperado, analisar e corrigir em caso negativo;
  • Desenvolver em PL/SQL para elaboração de mapas, dashboards e interface de dados entre os sistemas da companhia.

Requisitos mínimos

  • Formação superior em Informática, Sistemas de Informação ou áreas semelhantes;
  • Experiência profissional como PL/SQL Developer, preferencialmente em projetos de desenvolvimento e manutenção de sistemas;
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento e manutenção de consultas SQL para recuperação e manipulação de dados;
  • Colaboração na identificação e resolução de problemas de desempenho em consultas;
  • Capacidade analítica;
  • Dinamismo.

Local: Lisboa

Modelo de Trabalho: Híbrido 2x

Title: Supplier Master Data Analyst (M/F/D)
Description:
It’s an exciting time to be part of our collaborative inclusive team. Come and join our Global Digital & Business Services team on our journey to improve the well-being of millions. Together we can make a difference!

About The Role

Are you passionate about data and eager to make a global impact? Join our Master Data Organization and work with global stakeholders to ensure data quality and accuracy. This role focuses on Supplier/Vendor Master Data Management. As a Master Data Analyst, you'll set up governance procedures, solve data issues, and collaborate across teams. Be the gatekeeper of data integrity and drive impactful projects.

We’re looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk.

What You Will Do


Subject Matter Expertise in Business Partner Supplier Master Data: Ensure accurate setup and processes for master data. Continuously improve Supplier master data management.
Facilitate Process and System Requirements: Use techno-functional knowledge in MDG & S/4Hana, including Master Data Consolidation.
Manage Master Data Stakeholders: Support superusers and ensure adherence to Master Data policies. Promote best practices across the organization.
Act as Gatekeeper Between Teams: Communicate between Master Data, Procurement, Accounts Payable, IT, and business users. Ensure a global view of processes.
Contribute to Projects and Daily Operations: Participate in Supplier master data projects and testing. Manage daily tickets for data maintenance and requests.
Participate in Data Activities: Lead data cleansing, deduplication, and migration. Support data quality initiatives.
Ensure success of Master Data component in each project and take ownership calculation /developing of KPI’s, ad hoc reporting and data analysis.


Who You Are


University degree in Business, IT or related fields.
At least 4 years of experience in Supplier /Vendor Master Data , SAP MDG, and SAP S/4Hana, with strong skills in Master Data Governance and Consolidation tools.
Proficient in root cause analysis, proposing solutions, and gaining support.
Strong analytical skills, agile in international settings, excellent communicator, self-organized team player with a service mindset and global perspective.
Fluent in English - All Applicants are requested to deliver their CV in English language.


What we can offer you:

At Essity, we believe everyone's learning and professional development is unique and want to empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.

Collaborative and Inclusive Culture | Empowering & Engaged Leaders | Working with Powerful Purpose & Sustainable Impact | Learning and Growing in your Career | Supporting Well-being & Sustainable Working Life | Life-changing Innovations | Competitive Total rewards.

Application End Date:

17 jan. 2025

Job Requisition ID:

Essity249365

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A SynchroTech recruta Data Analyst para cliente no setor energético, localizado na região de Lisboa.

FUNÇÃO

  • Realizar análise e modelação de dados em ambientes de Data Warehouse, garantindo a organização e qualidade dos dados;
  • Criar User Stories para projetos relacionados ao Data Warehouse, facilitando o entendimento entre equipas técnicas e de negócio;
  • Extrair, transformar e analisar dados adhoc provenientes de sistemas comerciais e analíticos, gerando insights relevantes para a tomada de decisão;
  • Trabalhar com SQL para consultas e manipulação de dados, e com Excel avançado para elaboração de relatórios e análises;
  • Colaborar com equipas multidisciplinares, aplicando pensamento analítico e criatividade para resolver problemas complexos e propor soluções inovadoras.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Lisboa.
  • 40h/semanais.
  • Regime híbrido (1x por semana/ 1x de 15 em 15 dias).

REQUISITOS

  • Até 5 anos de experiência.
  • Conhecimento em linguagem SQL, ferramentas Office e em particular Excel nível avançado.
  • Capacidade analítica e de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, criatividade, iniciativa e proatividade são as competências que privilegiamos.
  • Experiência em criação de User Stories para o Data Warehouse.
  • Experiência em modelação de dados no Data Warehouse.
  • Experiência em Levantamento de dados adhoc provenientes de sistemas comerciais e/ou analíticos.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Vencimento Mensal;
  • Regime híbrido;
  • Subsídio de Alimentação;
  • Formação contínua;
  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Dias de férias extra;
  • Apoio em formações e desenvolvimento profissional;
  • Seguro de vida.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

SynchroTech by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis.

Title: Junior BI Consultant
HTML:
InnoWave is looking for a Junior BI Consultant to join our team!

Junior BI Consultant

Skills:

  • Professional experience in Business Intelligence (nice to have).
  • Design and develop reports, dashboards, and other data visualizations using Tableau;
  • Work with stakeholders to identify reporting requirements and design custom reports to meet specific business needs;
  • Extract and manipulate large data sets from various sources to create meaningful insights and trends;
  • Monitor and optimize performance to ensure fast and efficient report execution;
  • Collaborate with multicultural cross-functional teams;
  • SQL knowledge;
  • Knowledge of Microsoft BI tools, valuing experience with Power BI
  • Fluency in English.


InnoWave gives equal opportunity in employment regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, political beliefs, or any other factor. InnoWave will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement, do not submit resumes/CV's directly.

By answering to this job post, you consent the use of your data by InnoWave Group, for as long as necessary. We conduct regular data-cleansing and updating exercises to make sure the information we have is relevant and accurate. If you have any doubt or request to make relatively to your personal data, please send an e-mail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Step into a living ecosystem where the future of business is created and lived every day. Be part of it!

At LUZA Group, passion, perseverance, and the drive to excel define our path to success.

Founded in 2006, we are a Portuguese multinational with over 1,200 talented professionals and a turnover surpassing 30M. With a strong presence in key marketsPortugal, Spain, Morocco, Brazil, Mexico, the United States, and Chinawe deliver innovative solutions in engineering, IT, design, consulting, Industry 4.0, training, and recruitment. Our people and their talent power everything we do.

This is a moment of growth and opportunity. The future belongs to visionary minds. Will you join us?

Overview:

Analyzes and interprets data to provide actionable insights, supporting business decisions through reports, dashboards, and visualizations.

Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and analyze datasets to identify trends and insights.
Develop dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting needs.
Perform statistical analysis to support decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity.



Requirements:


Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of statistical methods and analytics tools (e.g., Python, R).
Experience in data wrangling and ETL processes.
Strong communication skills for presenting findings to non-technical audiences.



#VisionaryFuture - Build the future, join our living ecosystem!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.
