Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Data Analyst - Trainee Collections & Recoveries
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localização: Lisboa

Descrição Geral da Função

A Área de Collection and Recoveries está a procurar um Trainee para reforçar a sua equipa com um perfil de Data Analytics, que trabalhará sob a supervisão do Manager da área.

Principais Responsabilidades


Usar ferramentas de exploração, tratamento e extração de dados de diferentes fontes (principalmente SAS e SQL Developer);
Desenhar e criar dashboards para melhorar a visualização de dados e KPI’s que deem suporte as decisões e estratégias de negócio a implementar;
Capacidade analítica e interpretação de dados para construir estatísticas que permitam ao negócio tomar decisões ponderadas e sustentadas;
Colaborar com as áreas de negócio para a partilha de informação e discussão que envolvam dados e as suas fontes de informação;
Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação de negócio relacionadas com as carteiras de crédito e a recuperação de crédito para diferentes segmentos de clientes;


Requisitos


Percurso académico em Matemática, Estatística, Econometria, Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou semelhante
Conhecimentos de exploração e análise de dados (SAS Guide, SQL, Python, R ou semelhante);
Bons conhecimentos de MS-Office, nomeadamente Excel e PowerPoint;
Idiomas: Inglês (valoriza-se conhecimentos em Espanhol).
Perfil técnico com forte capacidade de otimização processos de extração de informação adaptadas aos requisitos de negócio
Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas
Autonomia, rigor, proatividade e orientação para resultados
Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders
Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo


Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst;
  • Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization;
  • Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools;
  • Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Fluency in English will be valued.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Join us in: Data Analyst

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ComparaJá.pt

ComparaJá.pt is a free and independent online comparison platform for financial services and products, with a clear mission: to help people saving time and money, in a quick and simple comparison tool.

Our goal is for Portuguese consumers to make informed and conscious financial decisions. For this, we provide a free, impartial, thorough and independent platform, where people can compare the various financial providers in the Portuguese market for home loans, personal loans, credit cards, telecommunication and energy providers, life insurance and saving accounts.

We are the #1 personal finance platform in Portugal for the users, our partners and media channels. We are part of Samlino Group, a European Investment Company that helps Europeans save time and money by making better choices about insurance, home services and banking products. In Europe, our sister companies are: Samlino.dk (Denmark), VertaaEnsin.fi (Finland), TopCompare.be & Tariefchecker.be (Belgium), and Pricefox.gr (Greece).

What You'll Do


You will support expansion and daily operations, analyzing marketing trends and participating in strategic projects.
You will be responsible and have full ownership of analytical work, with direct reporting to one of our Managing Directors.
You will collaborate with the different Marketing Teams (SEO, PR, paid social, Search), Product and Operational teams, being the point of contact for the key projects you are leading.
You will cooperate within a multicultural and multidisciplinary team developing and improving processes, with direct contact with the Group leadership team in London.


What We Expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:


Have acquired a bachelor or master's degree with outstanding results in Management, Marketing, Economics, Finance or another related field. Financial knowledge is a plus.
You are knowledgeable in MS Office and analytical tools. SQL knowledge is a plus.
You have a strong sense of ownership and initiative and a genuine interest in learning and act on the desire.
You have a strong affinity for critical thinking, analytical, hands-on execution, problem-solving, and result-orientation.
You have an EU work permit.
Plus: You are passionate about Marketing and Management, with a taste for Finance.


What We Offer


A workplace with great talents and leaders that will inspire and challenge you daily.
Responsibility for high impact projects that constantly push you out of your comfort zone and give you the opportunity to be the best you can.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Assume responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day.
Work on exciting and challenging projects and create an impact with new, innovative ideas.
Grow personally and professionally from working both independently and as part of an international group.
Work with and learn from experts and mentors in diverse fields.
Create strong and meaningful connections with your team members at exciting company events.
Be part of one of the most promising Portuguese fintech startups, with one goal in mind: help the Portuguese people saving money.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Worten, marca de retalho de eletrónica da Sonae, somos, no nosso ADN, uma empresa digital, com lojas físicas e um toque humano e líderes de mercado na nossa área de negócio. Temos como missão levar o melhor da tecnologia (e não só) a todos os consumidores. Com o maior site de e-commerce do País e mais de 240 lojas em Portugal e Espanha, continuamos sempre próximos dos clientes, disponibilizando preços baixos, atendimento personalizado, variedade de produtos e também de serviços, com vista a corresponder às suas necessidades e expectativas. Sempre.


Na Direção Supply Chain garantimos a entrega de qualquer artigo, em qualquer lugar e a qualquer hora. Alinhado com a estratégia omnicanal da marca, reforçamos o posicionamento da Worten no mercado, assegurando a realização dos desejos dos nossos clientes.


No Entreposto realizamos mais de 17.500 entregas por semana, para todo o país. Localizado na Azambuja, com cerca de 50 mil metros quadrados, preparamos, acondicionamos e expedimos, milhares de artigos para as nossas lojas, e diretamente para casa dos nossos clientes.



Na Worten promovemos uma cultura de inovação, diversidade, partilha, transparência e trabalho em equipa porque acreditamos que desta forma atingimos melhores resultados.



O teu dia-a-dia:


  • Desenvolver e acompanhar indicadores de gestão;
  • Suportar as equipas das diferentes àreas de negócio no processo de tomada de decisão;
  • Antecipar e interpretar tendências das áreas de negócio e desenvolver insights;
  • Comunicar/partilhar soluções analiticas com os diferentes stakeholders e implementar melhorias sempre que necessário.



O que procuramos:


  • Formação Superior em Engenharia ou Gestão Informação ou outras relevantes;
  • Experiência profissional de, pelo menos, 3 anos em áreas similares, com preferência pela área de risco;
  • Conhecimentos em SQL, PowerBi e Python;
  • Conhecimentos na ótica do utilizador de Microsoft Office, com destreza em Excel;
  • Conhecimentos em inglês escrito e falado (preferencial);
  • Capacidade analítica e espírito crítico;
  • Resiliência e foco em resultados/objetivos;
  • Proatividade, dinamismo e compromisso;
  • Capacidade de estruturação e resolução de problemas e capacidade analítica.



O que oferecemos:


  • Modelo de Trabalho Híbrido (regime atual em vigor de 2 dias presencial ( 1 dia no WTC, 1 dia no Entreposto e 3 dias remoto);
  • Shuttle até à sede com vários locais de recolha na Grande Lisboa;
  • Práticas de Work Life Balance, nomeadamente 2 dias de férias extra, incentivo aos estudos através da possibilidade de atribuição de bolsas, flexibilidade de horário dependendo da função, entre outras;
  • Práticas de Diversidade e Inclusão;
  • Oportunidades de crescimento através de Formação inicial e contínua adequada às tuas necessidades e objetivos;
  • Vantagens todo o ano em diversas áreas e parceiros.


Sabe mais na área de benefícios e vantagens.



Onde estamos:


  • Presentes em várias localizações e com sede no edifício World Trade Center.


Sabe mais na área onde estamos.



Direto ao que interessa? Candidata-te já!

Title: Analista de Dados (M/F)
HTML:
A Luís Simões é um operador logístico de referência, líder no mercado de fluxos rodoviários entre os dois países ibéricos.

Um dos nossos desígnios sociais é garantir a integração laboral, através da igualdade de oportunidades e de acesso ao mercado de trabalho de pessoas portadoras com deficiência (grau igual ou superior a 60%)


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado, preferencialmente em Engenharia, Economia, Gestão, Matemática ou Estatística;
  • Conhecimentos tecnológicos. É preferencial o conhecimento de ferramentas da Microsoft, por exemplo Fabric, Power Bi e adicionalmente ter conhecimento de SQL;
  • Experiência recomendada, entre 1 a 3 anos. A experiência em Tratamento, transformação e Analise de Dados de negócio. Será valorizado essa experiencia para negócios de Transporte e Logística;
  • Habilidade de comunicação para traduzir dados técnicos em insights de negócio.
  • Proatividade e resolução de problemas


Tarefas/Responsabilidade:

Desenvolvimento de Relatórios e Dashboards

  • Criar relatórios interativos e visualizações em Power BI que atendam às necessidades específicas das áreas de negócio;
  • Projetar e implementar dashboards personalizados, garantindo a clareza e boa utilização das informações;
  • Garantir a qualidade, consistência e integridade dos dados utilizados;
  • Capacitar as partes interessadas no uso dos relatório desenvolvidos;
  • Promover a cultura "data-driven" na organização.


Análise e Interpretação de Dados

  • Realizar análises exploratórias de dados para identificar tendências, padrões e oportunidades de melhoria nos processos de negócio;
  • Colaborar com as partes interessadas para entender requisitos e traduzir necessidades em soluções visuais de dados.


Manutenção e Suporte Técnico

  • Monitorar e otimizar o desempenho de relatórios e dashboards em produção;
  • Oferecer suporte às equipes internas na utilização e interpretação dos relatórios desenvolvidos;
  • Implementar permissões e restrições no Power BI para proteger informações sensíveis.

Title: Data Analyst - Microsoft
Description:
Estamos a recrutar um Data Analyst, para um dos nossos clientes, com escritórios em Lisboa.


3 a 5 anos de experiência a trabalhar como Analista de Dados/Engenheiro de Dados
Experiência na conceção e implementação de soluções inovadoras e baseadas em dados para enfrentar desafios empresariais complexos.


Responsabilidades


Conceptualizar, estruturar e projetar sistemas analíticos robustos adaptados para satisfazer as necessidades organizacionais.
Conceber arquiteturas escaláveis e eficientes para o processamento e análise de dados.
Construir e manter processos ETL/ELT para gerir o fluxo de dados e a integração em plataformas analíticas.
Aplicar um forte conhecimento dos princípios e práticas de modelação de dados, com foco nos ambientes Microsoft.
Desenvolva painéis interativos, relatórios e KPIs para uma visualização eficaz dos dados.


Competências Técnicas


Fortes conhecimentos de Microsoft SQL Server, incluindo SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) e SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services).
Conhecimento de conceitos e melhores práticas de computação em nuvem, principalmente em Microsoft Azure.
Experiência com serviços de dados Azure como Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, PowerBI
Python, R (Vantagem)


Se tens interesse, envia o teu CV para

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Company Description

AUTODOC is a technology company with a leading e-commerce platform for vehicle parts and accessories in Europe. Founded in 2008 in Berlin, we are now 5,000 people from 68 nationalities, collaborating to make mobility easy and sustainable. By placing technology at the core of everything we do, we manage to serve customers in 27 European countries in 23 languages.

Curious minds, adventurous experts, and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros in revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

A role that includes planning, implementing, and managing data sources, usage, maintenance of data assets for ongoing analysis, ongoing analysis of all business and data indicators, creating forecast scripts and methodology, preparation and analyze data for budgeting and UX research

Responsibilities

  • Knowledge of business domain zone (Preferably Finance);
  • Writing SQL scripts to check the correct operation of data sources;
  • Control of incidents related to data quality;
  • Ensuring compliance with the rules for the collection, storage, and use of data;
  • Standardization, Unification of business metrics and terms in the company;
  • Interaction with business experts to establish business rules and check their reflection in data sources;
  • Interaction with a team of data engineers - Error handling control;
  • Ensuring confidentiality and privacy of data;
  • Proficiency in English at the level of B2 "Above Intermediate" / C1 "Advanced";
  • Python, ML
  • Analyze UX research results with advanced statistics methods
  • Data visualization, dashboard creation (PowerBi)
  • Statistic analysis


Requirements

  • 3-5 years of experience in data and product analytics;
  • Data Analyst (BI) skills: deep understanding of BI, data analysis, visual analysis, knowledge of SQL fundamentals, deep understanding of all the capabilities of BI tools
  • Knowledge of the functional area of business (Finance), experience as a financial analyst;
  • Advance statistics knowledge;
  • Middle Python ML
  • Fundamentals of designing and working with corporate storages and data lakes (Data Warehouse, Data Lake), as well as ETL/ELT processes
  • Business analysis methods and techniques for identifying and formalizing data requirements;
  • Ability to work with large amounts of data and business information;
  • Ability to develop technical documentation;
  • Understanding data source maintenance processes.


Nice To Have

  • Experience with DataBase Clickhouse, certifications, e-commerce, or automotive domain


What do we offer?

  • Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
  • Fast-growing international company with stable employment
  • Annual vacation of 22 working days and 1 additional day off on your birthday
  • Meals Allowance
  • Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
  • AUTODOC Corporate Discount (1,080 Euros per annum) to order parts for their own use at special discounted rates
  • Retail discounts of up to 75% on travel, technology, fashion and much more
  • Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
  • Free English and German language classes
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work


Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: BI / Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description




AUTODOC is Europe’s leading online retailer for car spare parts. As the fastest-growing company in this sector, AUTODOC is aiming to expand its position further.




Now we are represented in 27 other European countries in addition to Germany. AUTODOC pursues a strong customer focus on social media, through technical support in the respective national language and a demand-oriented product range currently comprising almost 2.5 million items from 545 brand manufacturers for 128 car brands.




Job Description




Position Overview:

Our ideal candidate is a senior, business-savvy, technical data analyst who can identify opportunities, ideas and action plans from large amounts of data, capable and ready to make an impact. You are our person if you are able to dig deep into business data, challenge the status quo, confidently present findings and bring strong Power BI expertise.




Responsibilities

Design, develop & deploy advanced analytical solutions, to facilitate data-driven decision making.
Collaborate closely and cross-functionally with business stakeholders, to ensure a deep understanding of business needs and delivery of relevant and effective solutions.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers to define and build reliable data products and pipelines.
Communicate insights effectively, via interactive and user-friendly Power BI dashboards.
Support business users with training and onboarding to BI solutions.
Set and follow best-practices to ensure highest data quality and reliability standards.
Proactively identify, resolve and optimize performance and user experience issues.
Maintain effective and up-to-date documentation and training / onboarding materials.




Requirements

3+ years of experience as Business / Data Analyst, Analytics Engineer or similar.
Proven hands-on experience with delivering exceptional data products and analytics solutions.
Proven ability to present and communicate meaningful insights and recommendations.
Proficiency with SQL and Power BI – a must.
Proficiency with Python – an advantage.
Familiarity with e-commerce, supply-chain management - an advantage.
Self-learner, problem-solver, multi-tasker and a team-player.
Fluent in English, both in verbal and written form (C1 level or equivalent).
Background in a STEM degree, relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.




What do we offer?

Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Meals Allowance
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation of 22 working days and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Healthcare Insurance
Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
AUTODOC Corporate Discount (1,080 Euros per annum) to order parts for their own use at special discounted rate
Retail discounts of up to 75% on travel, technology, fashion and much more
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work




Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Show more

  • Collaborate closely and cross-functionally with business stakeholders, to ensure a deep understanding of business needs and delivery of relevant and effective solutions.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers to define and build reliable data products and pipelines.
  • Communicate insights effectively, via interactive and user-friendly Power BI dashboards.
  • Support business users with training and onboarding to BI solutions.
  • Set and follow best-practices to ensure highest data quality and reliability standards.
  • Proactively identify, resolve and optimize performance and user experience issues.
  • Maintain effective and up-to-date documentation and training / onboarding materials.


Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience as Business / Data Analyst, Analytics Engineer or similar.
  • Proven hands-on experience with delivering exceptional data products and analytics solutions.
  • Proven ability to present and communicate meaningful insights and recommendations.
  • Proficiency with SQL and Power BI – a must.
  • Proficiency with Python – an advantage.
  • Familiarity with e-commerce, supply-chain management - an advantage.
  • Self-learner, problem-solver, multi-tasker and a team-player.
  • Fluent in English, both in verbal and written form (C1 level or equivalent).
  • Background in a STEM degree, relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.


What do we offer?

  • Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
  • Meals Allowance
  • Fast growing international company with stable employment
  • Annual vacation of 22 working days and 1 additional day off on your birthday
  • Healthcare Insurance
  • Mental Wellbeing Program – the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
  • AUTODOC Corporate Discount (1,080 Euros per annum) to order parts for their own use at special discounted rate
  • Retail discounts of up to 75% on travel, technology, fashion and much more
  • Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
  • Free English and German language classes
  • Referral Program with attractive incentives
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work


Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Sobre Nós:

És apaixonado por fazer acontecer na área de IT? A Sourcing Trust, um parceiro da Catenon, está à procura de um Business Intelligence para se juntar à nossa equipa. Todos os nossos projetos são conhecidos por serem dinâmicos, desafiadores e em rápido crescimento, onde terás a oportunidade de atuar em diferentes mercados e setores, tanto em Portugal como internacionalmente.

Com uma cultura people-first fazemos com que cada colaborador seja parte integrante de uma estrutura maior, onde o seu bem-estar, satisfação e engagement são o mais importante.

Requisitos Obrigatórios:


+2 anos de experiência em SQL e capacidade de escrever e compreender consultas
Experiência no setor de Seguros (Valorizado)
Experiência com ferramentas de relatórios ou visualização de dados (PowerBI é uma mais-valia)
Experiência em modelagem de bases de dados (Valorizado)
Conhecimento em linguagens de programação (Programação Procedural ou Programação Orientada a Objetos)



Estás ansioso para dar o próximo passo na tua carreira e de teres a oportunidade de te envolveres em projetos inovadores e impactantes? Junta-te a nós e vem fazer parte de uma equipa que valoriza a excelência e a dedicação. #BecomeATruster

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • Minimum 5 years' experience in a similar role (extracting OLTP data from a company data warehouse);
  • Experience in the Policy & Claims Insurance area;
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL and of concepts and structures for Data Storage Architectures, ETL and BI;
  • Knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g. SQL Server, DB2), with experience in creating DDL;
  • Fluent English.

Title: Product Data Analyst – Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localização: Lisboa

Descrição Geral da Função

We are looking for an experienced and data-driven Product Data Analyst to join our Digital Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and a strong analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through dashboards and reporting tools.

Principais Responsabilidades


User interaction Analysis: Analyze web and app usage data to uncover trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.
Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate opportunities.
Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.
Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key success metrics for new features and initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure impact, and optimize product performance.
Dashboard Creation: Develop and maintain dashboards for continuous monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into performance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the product lifecycle.
Tool Optimization: Act as a subject matter expert in Google Analytics 4, ensuring best practices are followed and providing training or guidance to team members as needed.


Requisitos


Experience: 2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a fintech, digital product, or SaaS environment.
Analytics Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and familiarity with other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights and present findings effectively to stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex problems using data.
A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product hypotheses and feature performance.
Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.


Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Power BI and Data Trainee
HTML:
Sobre nós:

O GroupM é o líder global de gestão de investimentos em Media, atuando como empresa-mãe das agências de media da WPP: EssenceMediacom, Mindshare e Wavemaker, cada uma com operações globais próprias e posições de liderança no mercado.

O principal objetivo do GroupM é maximizar o desempenho das agências de media, criando e gerindo as estratégias de negócios das agências,desenvolvendo produtos e serviços, negociação, criação de conteúdo, digital, finanças, desenvolvimento de ferramentas proprietárias e outras necessidades críticas dos negócios.

O foco da GroupM é alavancar uma vantagem incomparável no mercado para os seus clientes, stakeholders e pessoas, de forma a que a publicidade funcione melhor para todos.

Sabe mais sobre o GroupM aqui.

Sobre a função:

Como Power BI and Data Treinee, farás parte da nossa equipa de Business Operations e terás oportunidade de aprender e desenvolver competências em Business Intelligence.

É fundamental que sejas orientado para os pormenores e que gostes muito de trabalhar com números.

Responsabilidades:

  • Ajudar na recolha, classificação e manutenção de dados para análise e utilização interna para melhoria e desenvolvimento do negócio;
  • Assistência na elaboração, desenvolvimento e atualização de relatórios e dashboards;
  • Efetuar verificações básicas de dados para garantir a exatidão, a coerência e a qualidade dos dados recolhidos e analisados;
  • Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com a equipa de operações comerciais para compreender as necessidades do negócio e das equipas e contribuir para os projetos.

Experiência:

  • Licenciatura numa área relevante como Data Analytics ou semelhante;
  • Atenção ao detalhe: grande preocupação com a exatidão e meticulosidade no tratamento de dados;
  • Aptidão Numérica: estares confortável em trabalhar com números e conceitos matemáticos básicos;
  • Conhecimentos básicos de informática (familiaridade com Excel ou outro software de folha de cálculo);
  • Interesse em aprender Power BI ou outras ferramentas de visualização de dados;
  • Entusiasmo para a aquisição de novas competências e conhecimentos;
  • Boas capacidades de comunicação verbal e escrita;
  • Fluência em português e inglês.

O que oferecemos:

  • Telemóvel para uso profissional + tarifário;
  • Dias de férias adicionais;
  • Plataformas de wellbeing e apoio ao work-life balance;
  • Acesso aos descontos do Grupo WPP (ginásios, restaurantes, hotéis, etc.);
  • Sistema de trabalho híbrido de acordo com a equipa na qual te inseres;
  • Café, fruta e cereais grátis para um pequeno almoço e lanche saudável.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
HTML:
WIRE IT is a global company specialized in IT services. We are supported by an experienced team that knows the IT market, allowing our customers to make the best decisions and accomplish their business goals.

We are currently looking for a Business Intelligence Consultant, with experience in Tableau, to join our team.

Location: Remote, Portugal.

Required skills:

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
  • Min. 2 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Consultant;
  • Proficiency in Tableau (data visualization/reporting);
  • Experience with cloud-based data platforms;
  • Experience with Snaplogic;
  • Strong SQL skills (query optimization and database management);
  • Knowledge of other BI tools or programming languages (plus);
  • Responsible and proactive;
  • Excellent communication skills;
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team;
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Fluency in English (spoken and written).


We offer:

  • No-term full-time contract;
  • Health Insurance;
  • 22 days of paid vacation;
  • 4 extra days annually (Carnival, Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, Birthday);
  • Meal Allowance on card (Coverflex);
  • Referral Bonus;
  • Special discounts and flex options;
  • Training annual budget;
  • A great team-oriented culture;
  • Chance to become a part of a dynamically growing international company;
  • Challenging projects giving the unique opportunity to grow and learn.


Following the EU General Data Protection Regulation No. 2016/679, we inform you that by responding to this announcement, you consent to the use of your data by Wire IT, for as long as necessary. In case of doubt or request for elimination of your personal data, please send an email to info@wireit.pt.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Collaborating with teams to understand their needs and expectations, and to provide them with data analytics support and recommendations.
Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear, actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Collecting, processing and analyzing data from various sources and systems, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.
Identifying, assessing and monitoring key risks and controls, using data analytics techniques such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Performing data quality checks and ensuring data integrity and reliability.
Staying abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and sharing best practices and knowledge
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor's/Master's degree in data/computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or a related field.
2/3 years relevant experience
Strong Power BI experience (data visualization/reporting)
Strong data manipulation, transformation, query languages knowledge (SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, DBT, Databricks)
Good understanding of statistical methods (statistical software exp. is a plus)
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to translate business needs into data models/analytics solutions.
Analytical with attention to detail and accuracy.
Problem-solving & methodical
Autonomous & multitasker
Proactive with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
At adidas Porto, our diverse team of over 900 employees, representing 40 nationalities, creates a powerful mix of global talent. Located in Maia, Porto, this location covers key areas such as Finance, Procurement, Accounts & Sales Ops, HR & Payroll, Supply Chain, Digital, Tech, and Data, among others.

We are running internships in 3 different Data areas: Data Science, Machine Learning, and Product Ownership.


As a Data Science intern, you'll support a proof of concept for Advanced Analytics within adidas' global supply chain. Your focus may include exploring machine learning applications for areas like global sourcing and customs, as well as potential uses of Generative AI.
As a Machine Learning intern, you’ll help bridge the gap between advanced AI research and practical, scalable solutions, empowering businesses across various domains. Join a project focused on designing user-friendly tools and frameworks to bring Generative AI into real-world industry applications.
As a Data Product Owner intern, you'll support the Demand Planning team by gathering and translating business requirements into Jira stories for the data engineering team. You'll work closely with stakeholders to ensure the requirements are clear, actionable, and aligned with project goals. Your role will also involve prioritizing tasks and ensuring smooth team communication to drive efficient product development.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Master's students in statistics, physics, mathematics, IT, system engineering, or related.
Enrolled in a Portuguese university and eligible for a curricular internship.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written.


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?


A paid internship up to 9 months with other adidas benefits.
Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours.
A sports-driven, international and diverse work environment.
State-of-art office space and conditions.


HOW WILL THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS BE?


Step 1. Apply with your English Resume.
Step 2. You'll receive a WePow for a pre-recorded video interview.
Step 3. You'll be invited for an on-site interview in our office.


The start date for this internship will be March 10th 2025.

adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
